Title: Assistant Engineer - Electrical (SUBMARINE)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job description:



Responsibilities:

 

Perform maintenance of marine electrical system/component in workshops and onboard vessels
Supervise a team of Electricians in planned and corrective maintenance
Perform corrective maintenance and planned maintenance
Perform electrical wiring, cabling and modification of electrical circuit.
Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures, using testing devices such as Multimeter, Insulation tester and Process calibrator
Participate in the repair of electrical components in workshop and onboard ships.

 

Requirements:

 

Diploma / NTC/ Higher NTC in Electrical Engineering and related field.
Preferably with at least 3 years working experience in electrical repairs and maintenance.
Experience in testing/calibration of high/low voltage equipment or fault analysis
Knowledge in both electrical/electronic system
Experience in DC system will be advantageous
Able to read electrical circuit drawings.
Preferably to have experience in DC/AC motors, Generators, Switchboards and Circuit breakers.
Able to perform troubleshooting and fault rectification during daily operations
Positive-attitude and having initiative to perform all works allocated to him
Willing to work in outdoor condition e.g heat, oil and dust
Willing to work in Changi area
Only Singapore Citizens need apply

 

Other Information:
 

Location: Changi
Transport provided at: Jurong West & East, Jalan Bahar, Choa Chu Kang MRT, Bukit Panjang, Woodlands MRT, Bukit Merah, Sengkang, Pasir Ris MRT, Tampines MRT, Tanah Merah MRT
5 days work week
Working Hours: 7.45am-5pm

Title: Temp for Migrant Workers' Centre
Description Snippet:
About the job

About Migrant Workers Centre (MWC)

 

Set up in 2009, the Migrant Workers‚Äô Centre (MWC) is a bipartite initiative of the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) and the Singapore National Employers Federation (SNEF). The MWC is a non-government organisation whose mission is to champion fair employment practices and the well-being of migrant workers in Singapore.

 

MWC is seeking to hire part-time Temp to support its membership recruitment. 




Responsibilities: 

¬∑ Engage migrant workers on the content prepared by MWC

¬∑ Escalate complicated queries (which are not found in training materials or FAQ) to any MWC staff on site or to the hotline provided

¬∑ Propose changes to enhance the operation or engaging of the workers, if any

¬∑ Assist with preparing daily and/or monthly reports, if any

¬∑ Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

¬∑ Prefer someone who can speak in one of the migrant workers‚Äô native languages (eg. Mandarin, Tamil, Bengali, Thai), as they need to interact with the migrant workers. 

 

The duties we expect of a candidate who performs this role include:

¬∑ Explaining the value proposition to migrant workers for them (workers) to understand the value of being an MWC member, 

¬∑ Apply critical thinking and creative solutioning skills should they encounter issues in signing up of members, 

¬∑ Interact with the workers to solicit feedback on how the recruitment can be enhanced; and 

¬∑ Articulate these findings to the PT‚Äôs supervisor(s).

¬∑ Prefers someone who can commit till December 2024

 




Details of the MWC membership program can be found here: https://www.mwc.org.sg/

Sengkang West (please note the work environment is non-airconditioned)

2pm to 5pm (Monday ‚Äì Friday)

Title: Guest Service Officer
Description Snippet:
About the job

About the Company

Hello! Welcome to Plaza Premium Group, we're people passionate about "Making Travel Better". We are a global company with team members from all walks of life, together we are #PPGFamily, together we are building a legacy. You don't need to be from this industry, you do need to be passionate.




Our promise to you:

We will respect and value your background and perspectives
We will work together with integrity
We will share our incredible pride for job, company and industry




What we ask of you:

Bring passion to all that you do
Listen, move fast and think innovatively
Speak up, have ideas and share them
Believe in customer service, and treating every person with kindness




As industry leaders in innovating global airport hospitality you will work with colleagues from all parts of the world for a truly global experience. You will help and craft services and facilities in over 200 locations in more than 60 international airports across the world.




We were established in HK in 1998 by someone who understood the value of an airport lounge and felt that the experience shouldn't just be limited to a closed-circuit group of travelers. Through the years we have worked incredibly hard to create an experience which is both accessible and quality. Almost 25 years later we now span four core business segments: airport lounges, airport terminal hotels, airport meet & greet services, and a range of airport dining concepts.




In addition to our own brands, PPG provides airport hospitality solutions to leading airlines, alliances and corporates around the world. Here are a few names you might recognize: Cathay Pacific Airways, Singapore Airlines, Lufthansa etc.




With the future of travel always in sight, we created Smart Traveler, a mobile-app rewards program underpinned by in-house technology. We are fast-moving and always evolving to drive our purpose of making travel better.




Join our family today.

Together, we'll make travel better.




About this position

The Guest Service Officer directly addresses the needs of all guests and ensures an exceptional guest experience. Represents the Hotel & Lounge to the guest throughout all stages of their stay. Determinates a guest's reservation status and identifies their duration of stay.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Register guests and to assigns rooms, accommodating special requests whenever possible.

‚Ä¢ Verifies the guest's method of payment and follows established credit-checking procedures.

‚Ä¢ Carry out regular checks of all areas, such as food counter, shower room, toilet, internet area to ensure cleanliness and tidiness at all times and the functionality of all facilities.

‚Ä¢ Overall, to achieve higher satisfaction level to Company‚Äôs target(s) set from time to time and conduct continual improvement to achieve the highest customer satisfaction level.




Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Relevant experiences in hotel or customer service is an advantage

‚Ä¢ Customer-orientated with a pleasant disposition and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment

‚Ä¢ Ability to multi-tasking while maintaining a positive attitude when working with guests and team members

‚Ä¢ Computer literate and able to navigate through the company system

‚Ä¢ Outgoing, good communication, interpersonal skills, active listening and showing empathy

‚Ä¢ Be willing to perform shift work and work on weekends, Public Holidays - 5 days work week

Title: Junior Data Engineer(Academy) Singapore
Description Snippet:
About the job

Hiring to create the future ready Data & Analytics professional!




Luxoft, a DXC Technology Company has embarked upon an extensive multi-year program to hire and upskill professionals and engage them in projects involving cutting edge data & analytics solutions for our extensive global clientele.




If you wish to progress your career into next gen data engineering, visualization, and advanced analytics solutions this opportunity is for you. We seek highly energetic Fresh Professionals with 0 to 3 years or Mid-Career Professionals with more than 3 years of experience having fundamental programming skills, analytical thinking, data concepts and a great passion to learn. Prior extensive experience in data & analytics projects is not mandatory but a definite plus.




This engagement shall involve an extensive 12 months training program (for Fresh Professionals) and 6 months training program (for Mid-Career Professionals) well interlaced with embedded on the job training in live internal or client projects. Post completion of training the candidate shall be certified as a "Data Warehouse & Big Data Professional" ready to be immediately deployed into client projects




Training details

In the course of this engagement candidates shall be trained on a variety of cutting edge data & analytics technologies such as:

1. Data modelling using different schema patterns such as Star/Snowflake/DataVault in Data Warehouse or Data Mining

2. Python programming

3. Hadoop architecture & HDFS storage platforms

4. Tools like Sqoop for Ingestion of data from source systems to HDFS

5. Apache Kafka architecture to create topics and partitions

6. ETL job development, monitoring & optimization using Hive script & Impala

7. Spark programming - Spark SQL, Spark Streaming

8. Data pipeline setup, analysis, insights & analytics using end to end data solutioning platforms such as Cloudera leveraging cloud infrastructure on AWS or Azure

9. Data quality, governance & security technologies




Training program shall also include other topics such as:

1. Communication management

2. Stakeholder management

3. Change management

4. Creative & computational thinking

5. Business analysis




Possible Roles post training period:

1. Data engineer

2. Data architect

3. Data visualization & analytics expert

4. Advanced data analytics expert

5. AI/ML expert

Title: Cyber Intelligence Analyst
Description Snippet:
About the job

What you will be working on




You will be part of the team with unique access to insights of cyber threat activities operating within Singapore's cyberspace, and your role is to attribute cyber threats and assess the potential impact to national security. As a Cyber Intelligence Analyst, you will undertake one or more of the following functional roles:




Conduct cyber intelligence investigations and research to derive insights and assessments, including producing intelligence reports to inform strategic stakeholders and decision-makers.
Provide strategic, operational and tactical analysis to help progress cyber investigations against cyber aggressors.
Perform cyber threat hunting to sniff out highly sophisticated cyber threats, including designing and developing new cyber threat hunting rules and use cases.
Apply data analytics know-how to detect for "signature-less" cyber attacks.
Perform technical analysis on computer artifacts (including computer forensics) to ascertain motivation and intent of perpetrator.
Perform malware analysis to identify tell-tale signs which could attribute and identify malware origin.
Apply data analytics know-how to perform malware classification and attribution.
Apply programming and coding skillsets to build cyber operational toolkits, automate investigative and analysis processes.
Analyze modern defence/exploit mitigation techniques against malware and validate their effectiveness against these emerging attacks.
Analyze CVEs/N-day vulnerabilities and develop/validate associated exploit code to demonstrate and determine severity of vulnerability.
Undertake cyber intelligence operations to engage and counter cyber aggressors.




What we are looking for




Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering and other related disciplines, or equivalent comptencies will be preferred
Critical thinkers with investigative mindset and the passion to pursue a career in the field of cyber intelligence
Applicants with no experience may apply
Relevant experience, certifications or demonstrable skillsets in one or more of the following areas would be advantageous:

- Cyber threat intelligence

- Understanding of networking and network protocols

- Malware analysis including reverse engineering

- Intrusion detection

- Computer forensics

- Penetration testing

- Data analytics

- Knowledge of Elasticsearch and Hadoop

- Experience in Python and/or bash scripting

Only Singaporeans need apply

Title: Electronics Design Engineer
Description Snippet:
About the job

This role is with BeeX, a startup supported by SGInnovate.




BeeX is building the world's most advanced Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (HAUVs). Our technology takes men and women out of dangerous environments, slash carbon footprint, and ultimately create a sustainable way to differentiate without cutting corners.




We started BeeX because we were frustrated by the manual, dangerous and inefficient methods of underwater work, as well as the high costs and complexities of integrating new tech. Leveraging on 9 years of R&D in underwater self-driving, we are focused on helping our partners achieve a transformative leap in conducting underwater operations.




Our flagship A.IKANBILIS HAUV has worked in challenging conditions alongside forward-thinking service providers; providing insights on the condition of near-shore assets - 200+ structural piles, 1000+ anodes, vessels, seabeds and tanks at unprecedented speed and quality. We are actively engaging with customers to build a 10X better and bigger variant for harsher conditions in Offshore Wind.




If you are from a Robotics competition team, racing car team, space development, vehicle development, or have built product from zero to one and taken it to full manufacturing scale, we want you to be part of our stellar team of impact engineers as we revolutionise the way underwater work is going to be done.




You will report directly to the Electronics Lead and your daily schedule will include frequent interactions with a multi-disciplinary team. You need to be equally comfortable working at sea trials and a normal desk in the office. This role is based in Singapore.




Responsibilities

Design and Implement sub-components of our Hovering Autonomous Underwater Vehicle and Surface Vessel.
PCB Design of Electronics boards for interfacing, operation and control of our vehicles.
Power electronics design to various system components, sensors and actuator systems.
Wire harness and cabling design and production drawing generation (2D and 3D).
Firmware development on microcontrollers such as Atmega and ARM for real-time control of hardware components.
Bench-testing and field testing of key sensors and components for integration to our vehicles.
Carry out intensive bench and in-water testing of our vehicles, and document performance.
Stress testing of system components for harsh environment operations such as thermal, vibration, EMI-EMC and humidity.
Gather user requirements in collaboration with management team and end customers.




Desired Qualities

Bachelor's Degree in Electronics, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
1-3 years of experience designing and implementing Electrical Architecture of robotic systems.
Experience with battery operated designs, embedded systems, microcontrollers, sensor and actuator interfacing.
Experience with low voltage power electronics design for battery operated systems (power regulation, boost/buck conversion, power protection, load balancing etc).
Experience with Altium designer and other equivalent PCB CAD software.
Experience with any 2D schematic, wire harnessing and cable assembly design software.
Experience with C++ for embedded systems programming and development.
Knowledge of python is a plus for high level interfacing and algorithms development.
Experience with git and version control systems.
Experience with quality control and test procedures for tests such as in EMI-EMC, Vibration, temperature, humidity testing is a plus.




Remuneration Package

Basic monthly salary with additional stock options




Prior to your interview, please prepare:

Testimonial of 1 other engineer who has worked with you
PCB Design from a previous project




Interested candidates may apply directly on DTC Marketplace at:

https://central.sginnovate.com/hub/marketplace/openings/68fbe5a9-bc71-4014-9983-a656af2ce78e?filter=ALL&keyword=beex

Title: Marketing Executive (Fresh Graduate)
Description Snippet:
About the job

We are seeking a dynamic and adaptable Marketing Executive to join our regional marketing team and play a vital role in driving our regional marketing efforts. While this position is an entry-level opportunity, your contributions will be pivotal in shaping and implementing regional marketing strategies.




Our ideal candidate will be a talented and creative graduate with a passion for marketing. Additionally, if you are organized, confident, and possess exceptional communication skills, we would love to connect with you.




Marketing Positions Available:

Digital Marketing Executive
Event & Operation Executive
Marketing Communication Executive




(1) Digital Marketing Executive

The Role

Support the regional marketing department in the following duties:

Plan and execute all digital marketing, including marketing database, email, social media, SEO and display advertising campaigns.
Maintain the social media presence and grow followers.
Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs).
Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies.
Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points.
Instrument conversion points and optimize user funnels.
Evaluate emerging technologies. Provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.
Other ad-hoc duties as assigned.




Skills Requirement:

Bachelor's degree in marketing or relevant discipline. Proven experience in digital marketing is preferred;
Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply;
Familiar with B2B experience in digital marketing and social media;
Experienced in setting up and optimizing social media campaigns that engage, inform and motivate target audiences;
Skills and experience in creative content writing;
Proficient in Adobe design software (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign);
Good command of English with strong written and presentation skills. Ability to read/write in Chinese will be a bonus in order to liaise with Chinese counterparties;
Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking, detailed ‚Äì oriented;
Knowledge in HTML is a plus.




(2) Event and Operation Executive 

The Role:

As the Event & Operation Executive, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the marketing events and administrative needs of the Regional Marketing Team, and becoming involved in a range of marketing, sales operations, and administrative support functions. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Production and delivery of projects from proposal to implementation.
Delivering events on time, within budget and meeting expectations
Setting, communicating and maintaining project/s timelines and priorities, including administrative requirements
Assisting in developing operational plans to ensure effective and efficient servicing for all stakeholders
Building and maintaining clients and supplier relationships
Working with stakeholders from different time zone
Provide necessary support to sales, marketing, and administrative functions as when required
Perform ad hoc duties when assigned




The Person:

Passionate event planner with some event management experience is an added advantage
Bilingual in English and Chinese in order to liaise with Chinese counterparties
Detail-oriented and insightful while multi-tasking
Able to travel to support events
Ability to handle pressure, multi-task and work within tight schedules/deadlines.
Good interpersonal and negotiation skills
Able to manage suppliers to maximize their service levels and while maintaining good working relations




(3) Marketing Communication Executive 

The Role

Support the regional marketing department in the following duties:

Support all communication activities including consultancy, development and execution of strategic marketing communications plans.
Provide writing and editing support for external and internal communications materials including media releases, speeches, and presentations.
Assist to create, develop & manage new sales & marketing communications contents/new product marketing collaterals (soft & hard copies).
Monitors and prepares reports on marketing performance to achieve marketing goals (KPIs) and ROI that increase branding and product awareness, engagement and sales where applicable.
Assist in PR campaign to drive customer awareness via public relations.
Analyses competitor activity and research opportunities that are beneficial for the brands and businesses.
Other ad-hoc duties as assigned.




Skills Requirement:

Bachelor's degree in mass communications or marketing. Proven experience in branding, marketing communications and public relations is preferred. Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.
Good written and spoken communication skills and strong ownership
Strong project management skills - able to juggle multiple projects, and execute them well
A proactive and collaborative team player who is able to work independently and in a team to deliver results with a keen eye for details
Proficient in Microsoft Office and working knowledge with design software and technologies (Such as Illustrator & Photoshop)

Title: Collections Analyst
Description Snippet:
About the job

Who is Choco Up




We are here to empower digital merchants and startups to realize their full growth potential!

 

We are Asia‚Äôs largest revenue-based financing and growth platform currently serving in 10+ countries (regions) with funding size of USD 10k ~ 10M.

 

Our fintech platform offers one-stop financial solutions for digital merchants in Asia to grow, via our data-driven funding, growth analytics, global payments, and virtual cards.

 




Why Choco Up




 

Choco Up is a fast-growing startup that is solving a massive funding problem for digital merchants and startups. In 2021 we have achieved 400% growth in funding amount deployed!

 

We have already helped hundreds of businesses across Asia and we are ready to serve thousands more with our experience and know-how.

 

Funding gap in Asia is a trillion-dollar problem and we are at the forefront of bridging this gap.

 




Why Collections Analyst?




 

As a Collections Analyst, you will assist the Senior Associate in taking ownership of invoicing customers, processing payments, and reconciling customer accounts. Your role will involve ensuring timely follow-up on overdue payments and handling customer inquiries regarding billing. You will collaborate with internal teams, maintain accurate records, and proactively identify opportunities to improve processes, resulting in enhanced efficiency and effectiveness in managing credit limits and terms.

 

 




 

What will you do (JD)




Generate and distribute accurate invoices on a timely basis
Manage debt collection from clients
Respond to client inquiries and resolve billing discrepancies and disputes
Run eGIRO / eDDA / other direct debit collections within the stipulated timeline and follow-up action on unsuccessful deduction
Ensure that invoices and incoming receipts are accounted for in the system
Follow up on unidentified receipts and ensure that receipts are updated promptly
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client accounts and payments
Prepare statements of accounts for clients
Liaise with relevant stakeholders to address any customer inquiries or concerns
Verify the accuracy of financial or transactional data (Data entry, administration duties and other ad-hoc duties when required)

 




You should be (qualifications)




Interest in finance and working with numbers.
Attention to detail in tracking and reconciling financial transactions
Enjoying communication and building relationships with customers and internal teams.
Problem-solving skills in resolving payment issues and discrepancies.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the finance field.
Associate degree or equivalent
Experience in accounts receivables / collections will be an advantage




Benefits

 




At Choco Up, we value our people and believe that individual‚Äôs successes make the company successful. We have a big goal and we work hard, so we want to give everyone the benefits that really help their success:




Competitive packages
Performance-based ESOP and bonus
Medical Insurance
Fast career progression
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge tech innovations leading in the globe
Join a prominent fintech startup and make a big impact to the lives of Asia‚Äôs entrepreneurs
Flat and open culture, be able to work directly with founding team

 




 

Why now







Choco Up is Asia‚Äôs leading revenue-based financing firm, with a huge, underserved population and big addressable market (USD 100bn+)
Fintech is disrupting Asia at a lightning speed and we are one of the leaders defining this industry
You will wear a lot of hats and work on different exciting parts of the company
You will be a key member to our culture, growth and ultimate success

About the job
We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.

The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:


Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.
Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.

The F4S Talent Pool process:

Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.

Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S‚Äôs revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviours, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfilment at work, and help build and scale high-performing teams.

Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.

Title: Cybersecurity Engineer (Penetration Testing) (1-year traineeship programme)

About the job

This project is with Fortiedge, a startup supported by SGInnovate under the PowerX Programme. 




PowerX is a 12-months traineeship programme designed to enable and create Deep Tech career opportunities for working professionals, combing bespoke training and industry experience.

The goals of vulnerability assessment and penetration testing are to:




Improve the overall security posture of the organization.
Reduce the risk of data breaches and other security incidents.
Enhance compliance with industry regulations.
Build trust and confidence with customers and stakeholders.




Vulnerability assessment and penetration testing can help trainees to better understand the following:




The different types of security vulnerabilities that can exist in IT systems and applications.
How to identify and exploit vulnerabilities.
How to develop and implement security controls to mitigate vulnerabilities.
The different stages of a penetration test.
The tools and techniques used in vulnerability assessment and penetration testing.




Overall, vulnerability assessment and penetration testing can be a valuable learning experience for trainees who are interested in pursuing a career in cybersecurity.

 Writing Sprouts, Potong Pasir (new!): located at the heart of Potong Pasir, steps away from Potong Pasir MRT and Poiz mall


We are seeking experienced, dynamic and driven primary school level English teachers to grow together with Writing Sprouts, and have a fulfilling career with attractive remuneration to match.

You can look forward to


monthly salary in the range of $3,800 to $6,000
various variable incentives that will bump up your basic salary
yearly bonus
being trained in the proprietary and effective Writing Sprouts' tailored coaching methodology to develop the love for reading, writing and speaking
career advancement opportunities in the teaching, curriculum development, centre management, business development tracks
expressing your ideas and having them implemented
a warm and supportive pro-family environment for both our parent-child customers, as well as our staff


Basic starting remuneration and benefits package to match qualifications, experience and job scope.

Working Hours

This is based on a 40 to 44 hour work-week plan, with earliest start time at 9am, and latest end time at 7pm. A typical weekly work schedule is fixed on a termly basis, according to operational requirements, and it comprises four weekdays plus Saturday or Sunday.

Your Checklist For Success


I HAVE at least a Bachelor degree.
I HAVE at least two years of relevant teaching experience (e.g. with MOE, international schools, tuition or enrichment industry in Singapore).
I AM familiar with the Singapore primary education landscape and examination requirements.
I HAVE a strong grasp of grammar; a good awareness of writing techniques and what constitutes good writing.
I LOVE working with children.
I AGREE with Writing Sprouts' vision, teaching philosophies and mission, and in my big or little ways breathe them in my personal and/or work life.
I AM a fast learner and able to adapt quickly to the School's teaching methods and culture.


WE LOVE to meet with you!

You enjoy added advantages if


Your degree specialisation is English Language or its equivalent/ are trained in creative writing/ journalism/ literature/ speech and drama/ performance theatre.
You are open and able to teach at the preschool and/or secondary levels.
You are open to work at both our locations
You love children literature and you are familiar with children's book titles.
You love reading and writing. Very often, you find yourself indulging in these hobbies.


So if you are ticking all the right boxes, you can send your personalised cover letter, stating clearly why you will make a great addition to the team and your near-term plans for the immediate two to four years, along with your full resume.

You can expect to hear from us within two weeks should you be shortlisted.

You should note that this position is only open to Singaporeans as in accordance with the relevant regulatory framework and authorities.

Desired Skills and Experience
Creative Writing, Multi Tasking, Classroom Management, Academic Tutoring, Elementary Education, Meet Deadlines, English Literature, Adaptability, Teaching English, Computer-savvy, Teaching Experience, Team Player, Storytelling, English Grammar, English Language Skills, Working with Children

Responsible for safety and security of the guests and employees of YWCA Fort Canning and all properties there-in. Guard all entrances to ensure that no unauthorized persons are permitted to enter YWCA Fort Canning. Assists in the detention of person/s found committing criminal offences.

Safeguard the property of guests, employees and premises from theft, vandalism, arson and other criminal acts, and take appropriate actions against any person/s doing so.

Title: Entry-Level Recruitment Consultant | Summer Start Dates
Description Snippet:
About the job

This is the perfect opportunity for Summer 2024 Grads seeking a great sales role!




As an Entry-Level Recruitment Consultant at Phaidon International, you will not only play a pivotal role in identifying and recruiting top talent, but will also be a key contributor to our sales efforts.

This role is perfect for individuals who thrive on building relationships, excel in a sales-driven environment, and are eager to kickstart a rewarding career in both recruitment and sales.




Job Overview

Title: Recruitment Consultant

Level: Entry Level

Location: Raffles Place (100% Onsite)

Compensation: Base Salary + Uncapped Monthly Commissions




About us:

Today, our business works with thousands of organizations across the world, ranging from the Fortune 500 through to venture backed start-ups ‚Äì all of whom use Phaidon‚Äôs services to find the right talent for their business-critical roles.




We deliver our capabilities through our deliberately curated group of 6 brands, each one specializing in the following industries where a relentless supply demand imbalance exists:

Financial Sciences & Services
Engineering & Infrastructure
Supply Chain
Life Sciences
Technology
Regulatory & Legal




You're who we're looking for if you have:

Bachelor's Degree or related experience
A track record of a solid work ethic
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proactive and results-oriented mindset
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and sales driven environment




How you will be recognized and compensated:

Promising career progression: We set achievable goals and promote based on merit. Most of our consultants achieve multiple promotions within their first 6-18 months in the business.
A competitive base salary + uncapped monthly commission: There is no limit to your earning potential
Comprehensive training and development program throughout your career: Cater to needs at different stages of your career
On the job training provided by organically-groomed leaders to ensure your market expertise
Recognition based rewards and leading healthcare benefits




Our ways of working:

We have won awards not only in our end markets, but for our internal culture, development and our ED&I. We care about who we work with and how we can make a difference. This also applies to who we hire. We seek individuals who are passionate about finding solutions for our clients and in turn we provide the platform to achieve success. 

In our meritocratic environment our values are at the core of what we do and are more than just words. Through employee-run forums, our training & development and our corporate initiatives to offset our carbon footprint we ensure that our business is a company that leads by example.




Reimagine your potential by joining the award-winning team today!




Joan Ng

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant (APAC)

joan.ng@phaidoninternational.com

Title: Sales Development Representative, Enterprise Sales
Description Snippet:
About the job
At Airwallex (airwallex.com), we‚Äôre building the future of global finance on one platform. Founded in 2015 in Melbourne, Airwallex is the leading financial technology platform for modern businesses to grow beyond borders. With one of the world‚Äôs most powerful payments infrastructure, our technology empowers businesses of all sizes to accept payments, move money globally, and simplify their financial operations, all on one single platform.

If you‚Äôre excited to do the most ambitious work of your career and change the way money moves around the world - join us!

Based out of our Singapore office, this role will be focused on generating and qualifying leads that will build Airwallex‚Äôs Singapore Enterprise sales pipeline. As a Sales Development Representative (SDR), you should be excited about engaging with prospects to find out about their needs, adept at identifying high value opportunities and capable of managing early sales funnel activities.

You are used to delivering value in complex situations and are energized by learning about new and existing products. Finally, you enjoy building ‚Äì you like to actively participate in the development of the demand generation and sales process, the articulation of Airwallex‚Äôs value proposition, and the creation of key tools and assets.

With the team, there are many opportunities to progress as the business continues to grow. If you‚Äôre hungry, smart, persistent, and a great teammate, we want to hear from you!

What you'll do:


Initiate contact with potential customers through email outreach or cold calling and follow up on designated touchpoints in a customer journey
Move quality leads through the funnel while connecting them to a salesperson and arranging meetings
Develop relationships with prospects to uncover needs through effective questioning to qualify interest and viability to prepare hand-off to sales
Update activity and contact information within the CRM system and support reporting efforts
Inform and recommend outreach strategies and best practices through testing various types of touchpoints
Contribute to building out best practices in this area as we grow the team 
Collaborate and provide feedback and insights to Marketing to help improve targeting and messaging
Work closely with your designated Account Executive on the handover & first call


What you'll bring:


Target-oriented - You are motivated by stretch targets that facilitate business growth and reward you for direct impact
Customer focused - You are excited to learn about your prospect‚Äôs business and rely on data to help solve issues
Process driven - You enjoy developing, documenting, and following procedures to ensure they are efficient, scalable, and defensible
A team player - You are a natural at building relationships with your colleagues but can work independently at ease
A master prioritizer - You leverage sound judgment to quickly assess all the tasks at hand and expertly prioritize them
Obsessively Curious - You know when to dig a little deeper to get to the bottom of a problem and solve it; in doing so, you ask the right questions necessary to arrive at a sound, risk-based decision
Track record of top performance or prior success in an BDR-related role
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Strong interest in technology and/or financial services
Self-starter who is able to operate in a hyper growth environment


At Airwallex you‚Äôll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. We want you to share in our success, which is why you‚Äôll be offered a competitive salary plus valuable equity within Airwallex. We also like to ensure we create the best environment for our people by providing a collaborative open office space with a fully stocked kitchen. We organize regular team building events and we give our people the freedom to be creative.

Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don‚Äôt regard color, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status when making our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.

Title: Learning Support Educator
Description Snippet:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Company Description

THKMC was incorporated on 13 October 2011 as a charity to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large, and achieved an Institute of Public Character (IPC) status on 18 November 2011. THKMC is the charitable arm of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society, which lives by the mission To Serve Mankind to help anyone who needs help regardless of their race, religion, colour, language, creed and culture. THKMC today serves more than 70,000 beneficiaries through more than 70 programmes across five Services, which include Disability, Early Intervention for Children, Family, Seniors' Community, and Therapy.

Responsibilities

Reports to the Senior Learning Support Educator, and/or DS-LS Programme Manager.

The LSEd is the key professional in LS. A preschool teacher by training, the LSEd serves as a resource in supporting children with mild developmental/ learning needs in the Early Childhood Education (ECE) landscape.

The LSEd's key roles would include (using the tools prescribed by ECDA):


Screen children flagged with learning and developmental issues by classroom teachers, using the prescribed screening tools
Present screening outcomes at Case Filter Meetings
Create the IEP for the child, in consultation with relevant clinicians, and follow through with the goals sets
Conduct LS based on the needs of the child and intensity required for each package
Provide in-class support to children receiving DS or LS packages
Ensure IEP goals set are achieved and strategies generalised back into the classroom
Complete EOI report at end of LS cycle
Conduct post-screening for children who have completed DS or LS packages
Liaise with preschool teachers, parents, and other professionals in the multidisciplinary team e.g. Occupational Therapists, Speech and Language Therapists, Educational Therapists, Psychologists, Social Workers etc.
Complete reports in a timely manner
Attend trainings conducted by KKH


QUALIFICATIONS


Minimum relevant diploma in ECE, e.g. Diploma in Early Childhood Care and Education (Teaching) and DECCET


OTHER INFORMATION


2 to 3 years of working experience in the early childhood sector


Required Training


Specialist Diploma in Early Childhood Learning Support (SDELS) or be open for company sponsorship of the SDELS upon entry
Good people skills and can communicate professionally and effectively
Good presentation skills
Timely reporting, good with paperwork
Adaptable to changes 
Team player 
Able to work independently 
Have some understanding of the diverse cultures and races 
Has patience and commitment in the education of & nurturing young children and empowering the families 
Keen to develop professionally 


Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

Desired Skills and Experience
Excellent Communication Skills, Teamwork, Leadership, Information Technology, Leadership Development, Positive Team Player, Team Building, self-motivated Team Player, Team Player, Team Work

Title: Project Admin - Grant (NEHR)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Position Overview

The National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) is a key enabler for Singapore‚Äôs strategic vision of "One Patient, One Health Record". It receives patients‚Äô key health information from different healthcare settings and consolidates into a holistic picture of patients‚Äô healthcare history, enabling greater coordination and informed decision-making, and support for more accurate diagnosis, improved treatment, and patient-centric integrated care.

With "One Patient, One Health Record", care teams would be able to deliver safer, better and more personalised care for patients.

Role & Responsibilities 


 You will be part of a team to create awareness to the healthcare institutions to encourage early data contribution to NEHR. This is one of the MOH‚Äôs initiative to improve data comprehensiveness in NEHR for better patient care. 
 You will have the opportunity to be involved in various types of engagement activities with the healthcare institutions. 
 You will manage, provide guidance and assistance to the healthcare institutions throughout the early data contribution journey. This includes:
 securing agreements 
 obtaining required documentation 
 reporting risks and issues 
 You will track and report engagement and onboarding statuses. 
 Training will be provided on the NEHR functionalities, data onboarding process and the governing policies. 
 Supports the Grant Management process from planning to operations and ensuring alignment with MOH policies to achieve the objective of mandatory contribution. 
 Supports related funding requests with internal and external stakeholders. 
 Establishes grant principles, processes and SOPs. 
 Monitors and regularly updates the status of utilisation to management. 
 Works closely with external grant partners i.e. IMDA, MTI, auditors and internal Finance. 


Requirements


 At least 1-3 year‚Äôs experience in customer facing roles such as tele-marketing, sales, business development, outreach, account and/or case management 
 Ability to do presentation and able to articulate clearly to target audience 
 Strong interpersonal skills. Able to work with different groups of internal and external stakeholders 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Meticulous in status tracking and confident in reporting statuses 
 Strong analytical, problem solving and root cause analysis skills 
 Quick learner who is able to cope in a fast-paced and dynamic environment 
 Experience in using MS Excel, Word, Powerpoint 
 Experience in healthcare industry would be an added advantage

Title: Global SEO Specialist
Description Snippet:
About the job
At Airwallex (airwallex.com), we‚Äôre building the future of global finance on one platform. Founded in 2015 in Melbourne, Airwallex is the leading financial technology platform for modern businesses to grow beyond borders. With one of the world‚Äôs most powerful payments infrastructure, our technology empowers businesses of all sizes to accept payments, move money globally, and simplify their financial operations, all on one single platform.

If you‚Äôre excited to do the most ambitious work of your career and change the way money moves around the world - join us!

We're on the lookout for a talented SEO specialist to scale and support our SEO efforts, drive high-intent organic traffic and improve revenue growth. This is a unique opportunity to join the newly formed Global Growth Marketing Team and help shape our SEO approach.

In this role, you'll support the Senior SEO Manager in shaping our global SEO strategy, and contribute to broader awareness and acquisition initiatives. Airwallex is ambitious about the role of organic as part of our growth model due to its strong fit with high volume SMB customer acquisition. This is a cross-functional role that will work closely with Growth Marketing, Content Marketing, Product, RevOps and Data teams, in an executional and strategic capacity. Your work will have a global impact, as you collaborate and support the overall organic growth of Airwallex.

Our teams move fast, we're growing at an incredible rate and learning along the way. If you're energised by the above, we'd love to hear from you.

Responsibilities


Support the website's organic growth target with our Corpsite and Content teams
Evangelize SEO in terms of website changes impacting SEO, link acquisition and organic content (in conjunction with our Content team),
Proactive in identifying new opportunities / optimising on existing revenue levers, taking a kaizen approach to growth
Competitive intelligence, understanding competitor trends and activities in the marketplace, and help Airwallex be ahead
Be a channel conduit in ensuring SEO best practices and processes are implemented across the different regional websites 
Help develop and scale our offsite backlink profile in order to improve the overall domain authority of the website
Liaising with engineers in executing technical recommendations, that will benefit not only SEO but wider business teams
Hands on experience in giving recommendations, and making changes within the CMS platform
Comfortable and experienced in working with product managers and developers in scoping out and writing out new website feature requirements
Prescriptive hands on approach to supporting our Content Team to produce prospect/customer-friendly content that supports acquisition and awareness
Iterative approach to conversion rate optimisation, in ensuring we‚Äôre constantly monitoring and optimising on revenue driving opportunities
Track, monitor and help report on SEO campaigns in understanding what is driving revenue and growth
Help establish Airwallex as an SEO leader in the financial services & technology space.


What You Will Bring


4+ years experience in SEO, with 2+ years experience in B2B, SaaS or Fintech
Proven track record of driving organic revenue
Good understanding of international SEO and B2B marketing
Ability to measure all aspects of SEO performance, work in a cross-functional environment and turn data into insights and actions
Comfortable in a fast-moving startup culture - growth-minded and comfortable with ambiguity
Strong analytical skills to make data-driven decisions for commercial and operational performance
Strong understanding of EEAT within YMYL verticals
Strong understanding of online copywriting and how it impacts SEO
Entrepreneurial mindset and a willingness to be hands on
Confident communication skills for reporting to stakeholders at different levels, ability to influence people across the organisation
Good HTML and CSS knowledge beneficial
Good working knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs

Job Description:
 Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. We‚Äôre driving growth through our strong client franchise. All this means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients. 

dbAcademy is our three-day programme, specifically designed to show you what the future of a global bank looks like, inspire you with what we‚Äôre doing to achieve this and introduce you to the full range of opportunities at Deutsche Bank. You will have a chance to meet with various level of colleagues and learn from our recruiters, as you get the inside knowledge on how you can stand out as a candidate. We‚Äôre looking for talented and driven students to bring their unique perspective to our diverse teams. This is your chance to immerse yourself in our inclusive culture.

We welcome all students studying in any discipline who are graduating between December 2025 to July 2026 to apply. This is an in-person event from 14th May to 16th May 2024 in our Singapore office. Attendees will need to be available to join us in-person for the entire 3 days of programme to be considered.

CV submission is required and applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, followed by the invitation of online assessment as part of the screening process.

About us and our teams:

Our values define the working environment we strive to create ‚Äì diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. Title: Butler
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Number 24047064

Job Category Rooms & Guest Services Operations

Location The St. Regis Singapore, 29 Tanglin Road, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore VIEW ON MAP

Schedule Full-Time

Located Remotely? N

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Position Summary

As the original house of luxury, St. Regis continues to redefine modern luxury through service. At the core is the Butler program, an icon to our heritage and the heart and soul of new luxury. It is high-touch, personalized, creative and original. It is brought to life by all talent but serving as the primary face to the program is our Butler team, who are the ultimate luxury ambassadors.

The Butler provides bespoke experiences and services to fulfill all guest needs during pre-arrival, check-in, throughout the stay and upon departure, in partnership with other departments in the hotel operation. This includes coordinating efforts of Butler Valets, and verifying that other departments supporting butler services are equipped to meet guest needs. The Butler is key to building rapport with guests, proactively anticipate guest needs and acting upon them where possible.

While the St. Regis brand is steeped in history with roots that can be traced back to the early 1900s, every team member is part of a trailblazing future to redefine modern luxury through service. The Butler‚Äôs success is rooted in a deep passion for service, uncompromising standards, the ability to anticipate needs and impeccable interpersonal skills.

You will also be expected to create a safe workplace, follow company policies and procedures, uphold quality standards, and ensure your uniform, personal appearance, and communications are professional. Butler team members will be on their feet and moving around (stand, sit, or walk for an extended time) and taking a hands-on approach to work (move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance). Doing all these things well (and other reasonable job duties as requested) is critical for Butler team members ‚Äì to get it right for our guests and our business each and every time.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

Required Qualifications

Related Work Experience: 6-months related work experience required.

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Combining timeless glamour with a vanguard spirit, St. Regis Hotels & Resorts is committed to delivering exquisite experiences at more than 50 luxury hotels and resorts in the best addresses around the world. Beginning with the debut of The St. Regis hotel in New York by John Jacob Astor IV at the dawn of the twentieth century, the brand has remained committed to an uncompromising level of bespoke and anticipatory service for all of its guests, delivered flawlessly by a team of gracious hosts that combine classic sophistication and modern sensibility, as well as our signature Butler Service. We invite you to explore careers at St. Regis. In joining St. Regis, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

Title: Lower Secondary Science Teacher | Semi-flexi WFH | Full-time, Permanent
Description Snippet:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you passionate about inspiring curious minds to love Science while growing in a career that pays you well?

If your answer is a resounding YES, The Pique Lab WANTS you!

[About Our Team]

At The Pique Lab, we‚Äôre on a mission to create the best Science learning experience for students aged 9 to 16 in Singapore. Our lessons are meticulously crafted based on pedagogical research, data-driven methodologies and have one overarching goal: to make learning fun, shorten learning curves and help students develop a genuine appreciation for Science.

Over the past decade, we've grown from a pair of co-founders to a diverse team of over 80 team members across 10 departments. Our proprietary learning methodology and examination-centric materials have helped more than 20,000 students ace their Science examinations.

Our headquarters is in Singapore, with additional offices in China, Philippines and Malaysia. We take pride in our open, fast-paced and flat organisational structure where every team member is valued for their skills and competencies, not just their job titles.

We are looking for passionate Science lovers to join us to bring the joy of learning to more children. Who knows? You might be nurturing the next Albert Einstein or Marie Curie!

If you like the prospects of working in a close-knit team, leveraging tech to work hyper-efficiently while tackling challenges head-on, we‚Äôd love to talk to you about joining the team!

[Your Role]

As a Primary Science Teacher at The Pique Lab, you will be involved in:


Class & Learning Management ‚Äì You will manage classes (online & onsite) effectively with a holistic understanding of your students‚Äô learning needs and motivations
Lesson Preparation & Delivery ‚Äì You‚Äôll prepare for your lessons in accordance to our curriculum. In particular, you‚Äôll devise ways to simplify Science concepts and highlight common misconceptions.
Publishing ‚Äì You‚Äôll share your knowledge by writing articles and producing videos, so that your students can continue to learn from you outside of the classroom.
Communication ‚Äì You‚Äôll communicate with parents on their children‚Äôs learning progress and make appropriate recommendations on how to improve further.


[Your Growth]

Your success as a Lower Secondary Science Tutor means a lot to us.

Rigorous training is provided during your first 9 months at The Pique Lab, which is aimed at increasing your confidence and expertise as a Primary Science Teacher.

Skills

You will start your career with us by undergoing the Teaching Associate Programme where you'll learn plenty of valuable teaching skills:


Content Mastery: Solidify your fundamentals in the Primary Science syllabus by learning key concepts & examination question types. Understand how to apply a variety of answering techniques to tackle questions effectively.
Attention Control: Discover how to make your lessons come alive, such that your students never get bored of them. Dive deep into delivery technicals such as coherency, clarity, tempo, gestures, expression and humour.
Class Control: Pick up effective classroom management strategies, so that you're able to maintain a fun, yet disciplined teaching approach with your students.
Performance Management: Learn how to use cues effectively to instil a stronger sense of confidence in your students & help them develop a stronger affinity for Science.
Communicating With Parents: Understand how to communicate with parents, such that they are supportive and appreciative of your work.


After you've achieved mastery in your fundamentals, you can look forward to explore various career pathways (Specialist Track & Management Track) where we'll work closely with you to spearhead projects or manage teams.

[You, Our Ideal Candidate]

We‚Äôd love to have a chat with you if you meet the following criteria:

Required


Strong Background in Science: You should have a strong understanding in the subject matter - not just at the university level, but at a primary/secondary level, and hence be able to simplify complex Science concepts.
Prior Teaching Experience: You should have some experience in teaching, not strictly limited to Science - be it commercial experience (e.g. teaching in MOE schools, tuition centres or private 1-1 classes) OR volunteering experience (e.g. coaching kids in after-school care centres).


Good To Have


A Positive, Confident & Engaging Personality: You need to be comfortable engaging students at a group level & infuse joy and laughter in your lessons.
Grit and Drive to Succeed: You must be committed to mastery and be willing to put in the hard work. You should have a clear idea on what you intend to pursue in your career, at least for the next 3 to 5 years,
Ability to learn fast and think on your feet: You will be expected to pick up and apply strategies and techniques taught to you quickly, especially during the training period.


[Your Welfare]


[Biggest Takeaway] Mentorship, Training & Regular Feedback
Abundant Career Progression Opportunities in two different tracks: Specialist track and Management track
Competitive Remuneration, including a base salary (starting from $3,400/ month) plus a variable pay (which scales based on your contributions)
Annual Performance Bonus
Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits
Technology Benefits
Paid Leaves
Time-off From Work For Errands
Fully-stocked Pantry
Free Meals on selected school holidays and weekends
Company Socials
Work From Home Care Packages


[Take Note]


We respect your time commitment with us. As such, you'll be paid full salary, even during your training period.
There are no part-time teaching positions due to the amount of resources required to groom teachers to excellence.
We specialise only in Primary Science and will continue to deepen our expertise in this area within the next 3 to 5 years. If you're only keen to teach Mathematics or English, we're probably not a good fit for you.


Desired Skills and Experience
one to one tuition, Classroom, Science, Teaching, Classroom Management, Tuition, Teaching Skills, Teaching Experience, Teaching Children, Learning Management

This role provides a unique opportunity to gain a high level perspective on Temasek‚Äôs portfolio, investment activities, strategy and focus areas as well to participate in developing plans and programmes to address ongoing organizational needs and opportunities as we continue to expand the scale and scope of our activities and broaden and deepen our investment expertise. As part of the Investment Group Office (IGO) team, the responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:


 Internal reporting and management
 Assist IG head and senior management in periodic internal and external presentation and reporting requirements, such as quarterly portfolio reviews, discussion materials for Board meetings 
 Work alongside functional teams to track and manage investment activities (e.g. investment pipelines, approvals and liquidity tracking, investment plans) 
 Portfolio analysis
 Analyze investment portfolio parameters to provide insights on investment outcomes and portfolio performance 
 Derive inputs to frame overall investment strategy and direction (e.g. investment focus, capital allocation etc.) 
 Identify portfolio opportunities and vulnerabilities and coordinate portfolio strategy ideas within IG and with other groups, such as PSRG and Corporate Finance 
 Cross-sector/market projects to improve IG‚Äôs investment capabilities:
 Work with various investment and functional teams across a range of impactful and strategic projects (e.g. analyzing portfolio mix and investment attributes, corporate governance trends and tracking, board representation analysis for investments, managing investments aligned with trends across sectors/markets) 
 Review business processes in light of the systems and provide/conduct training as necessary and represent investment groups to manage the development of investment management technology projects 


Qualifications & Capabilities


 Preferably 2-3 years of experience working in a front office, front office support, accounting/audit or business manager function
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (preferably in Finance / Business / Accounting discipline)
 Self-starter with a proven ability to manage multiple projects
 Good interpersonal skills ‚Äì ability to work well with different teams
 Strong competence in MS excel modeling and powerpoint skills required
 Familiarity with Bloomberg, Capital IQ as well as data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Qliksense) and programming languages (e.g. Python) would be preferred.

Title: Associate Business Technology (Finance)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

The successful candidate will join Business Technology (Finance) Department in SIA Finance Division. He/She is required to provide effective operational and IT administrative support for various Finance applications. This includes taking on the Finance IT Coordinator role, managing end-to-end delivery of minor application enhancements, and performing bank account administrative duties.

Key Responsibilities


Provide effective operational support for various Finance systems. Activities include assisting users on system authorization, usage, administration, maintenance, providing IT administrative support to Finance users to enable them to access computer applications, and coordinating the annual user recertification and PC/Notebook refresh exercise.
Work with IT Division/IT vendors to ensure reported incidents (e.g. bugs) are resolved within Service Level Agreement. This includes ensuring periodic and interface jobs are completed successfully within agreed timeline. 
Manage the end-to-end delivery of minor application enhancements, by working closely with business units and vendors to identify areas of improvement, reviewing suitability and sustainability of proposed solutions, and ensuring smooth implementation of enhancement.
Facilitating execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and tracking of UAT issues to ensure that all test scenarios are comprehensively and successfully tested
Tracking delivery of relevant business process and IT documentation and reporting project progress / status to project sponsor
In charge of bank account administration duties such as assisting in station‚Äôs request to create/maintain vendor bank account details, ensuring station has complied with the procedure/process documented in Finance Manual and all supporting documents are provided in the request.
Create and update bank accounts of Head Office vendors, staff and Treasury‚Äôs business partners in SAP after receiving completed request forms with supporting documents.
Other administrative duties include:
Preparing yearly Long Service Awards ceremony for Finance Division, Airport Pass renewal administration, interested Party Transaction (IPT) coordination, course nomination coordination, Fire Warden for department, and assisting the setting up equipment for quarterly Finance Division communication sessions.


Requirements


Possess a diploma in any discipline, preferably in IT-related disciple, Business Administration or Finance.
Working experience in similar IT support role and knowledge of SAP FICO and Sharepoint will be advantageous.
Strong learning capabilities, self-driven, and able to work independently, collaboratively and under tight deadlines.
Good inter-personal and communication skills.
Organized, meticulous, task-oriented and good attention to details.
Ability to manage time and prioritize work accordingly.
Adaptable to changes and a problem solver.
Proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel and Powerpoint.


We thank all candidates for your interest in Singapore Airlines, and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: PROGRAM SPECIALIST V (HEMP PROGRAM) - DOWNTOWN, OAHU
Description Snippet:
About the job
Recruitment Information

Recruitment Number 24-0094

Salary:  $5,713 to $6,949 per month (SR-24, Step D to I)

The current vacancy position is a permanent, full-time position.

Hiring rates will be based on availability of funds, the applicant's qualifications, and other relevant factors.

A continuous recruitment may be closed at any time. The notice of the last day to file applications will be posted on the? State of Hawaii's Civil Service Job Opportunities Listing ?page?of our website.

Duties Summary

Positions in the Program Specialist series perform and/or supervise professional work in planning, developing, coordinating, monitoring and evaluating programs, operations and activities in support of an agency's program. The work involves conducting studies, research, and analyses to identify needs or recommend solutions to problems; developing program plans, policies and procedures, rules and regulations, for the monitoring and maintenance of current programs or establishment of new programs and services; or providing advisory services, training, serving as liaison or resource to community organizations or others concerned with the agency's programs and activities for the implementation of new or revised programs or functions.

The current vacancy position is located in the Department of Agriculture (HDOA), Quality Assurance division. The Quality Assurance Division serves agricultural producers and all consumers in the State by improving market quality of agricultural commodities and the promotion of fair trade and honesty in the marketing of farm products and all other goods and services sold in units based on a measurement process or subject to quality standards enforced by the Division. 

The primary purpose of this position is to develop and manage the HDOA hemp program which includes the coordination and implementation of new or revised program plans, policies, functions, and procedures.

Duties and responsibilities of this position include serving as the primary point of contact for the hemp program and the technical expert with regard to the interpretation and application of State statutes, administrative rules, and department policies and procedures; recommending and submitting drafts to establish, amend or repeal statutes, rules and policies related to the hemp program, and preparing testimonies on proposed amendments; developing and maintaining working relationships with the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Drug Enforcement Administration, Hawai‚Äòi State Department of Public Safety, Hawai‚Äòi Department of Health, and other industry and state agencies to ensure the alignment of HDOA hemp program with state and federal laws, rules, and regulations; serving as the liaison between commercial hemp producers and HDOA, communicating program policies, rules, and program updates; monitoring and evaluating program operations and activities to ensure program objectives, and State and Federal requirements are being met; responsible for enforcement of the laws and regulations of Hawai‚Äòi commercial hemp production program, which includes but not limited to ensuring compliance with hemp buffer zones, monitoring hemp transport and reviewing movement reports to ensure compliance with the law.

Positions at the Program Specialist V level are typically reflective of three general types:

A: A program specialist that  supervises a staff of program specialists performing program planning and development work, and in addition, may participate in the performance of various program planning and development activities in support of an agency's program; 

B: A program specialist located at the departmental or division level, with responsibility for  all of the program planning, development, and implementation activities for one or more major components of the agency's overall program. Such responsibility has a MAJOR impact on the program's operations and services and includes, but is not limited to, being cognizant of changes to State and federal laws, legislation, policies, etc.; evaluating their impact on program goals and priorities, and resolving any issues or problems; anticipating and determining the need and making recommendations for review and development of new or revised plans, goals and objectives; ensuring that the coordination and implementation of new or revised program plans, policies, functions, work processes, etc., are properly and efficiently executed; and providing advice and consultation to managers, supervisors and others. Technical determinations are not normally questioned and the specialist is given considerable authority to coordinate work activities with federal and other State and private agencies in the planning and development of new or improved plans, policies, standards, operations, etc.;

C: A program specialist located at the departmental or division level, performing  the most complex, extensive, and intensive program development, implementation, and evaluation assignments.  The intensity of the agency's program is such that it requires the constant development of new or revised programs and plans, policies and standards, etc., to meet constantly changing federal requirements, legislative mandates, or consumer needs. The assignments are highly developmental, and involve solving unprecedented issues or controversial problems, or developing new concepts or methodologies that impact the entire agency's operations, goals and objectives, or provision of services. Considerable resourcefulness and creativity are required in the development of new programs and services, and recommendations carry considerable weight.

Minimum Qualification Requirements

To qualify, you must meet all of the following requirements:

 Basic Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited four-year college or university.

 General Experience: One and one-half (1-1/2) years of progressively responsible professional work experience which required a high degree of analytical skill. Such experience must have involved gathering, evaluating and analyzing facts and other pertinent information required to resolve problems and/or to determine and recommend appropriate courses of action.

 Specialized Experience: Two (2) years of progressively responsible professional experience in one or a combination of the following:


 Type 1: Professional work experience in any field which involved work such as monitoring, evaluating, or conducting studies and analyses of programs or projects to make recommendations for the development or revision of standards, policies, procedures, or techniques; gathering and analyzing data to determine conformance with standards and requirements and recommending improvements or developing training materials; and giving technical advice and direction pertaining to program standards, requirements, or techniques.
 Type 2: Professional experience in a pertinent field/program area related to the agency's/program's role, function, operations, and/or program activities which provided knowledge of principles and practices, current issues and concerns of the identified field/program area and State and federal agencies, community, resources and services that interact with and have an impact on the agency's programs and activities.


 Selective Certification Requirement (Hemp Program Experience): In order to effectively perform the duties and responsibilities of this position, applicants must possess  demonstrated knowledge  of pertinent Federal and state laws, rules, policies, procedures and other commercial hemp production requirements; federal, state and county governmental organization and functions; local and national agricultural transportation systems and facilities and the functional, operational, and administrative aspects of the various sectors within these systems; and the organization and function of agricultural cooperatives, and associations. Applicants must also possess  the ability to  understand and apply pertinent principles, practices, methods and techniques related to hemp program planning, developing, monitoring, or evaluating; establish and maintain effective relationships with government officials, stakeholders, supervisors, co-workers, and demonstrate a high degree of professionalism.

Based on the knowledge, skills, and abilities required for performance of the above duties and responsibilities, the Specialized Experience  (refer to Type 2 above)  requirement is identified as progressively responsible professional work experience in a hemp program which provided the above knowledge, skills, and abilities. 

Therefore, of the two (2) years of Specialized Experience above,  applicants must possess at least one (1) year of progressively responsible professional work experience involving the development, management, coordination, or implementation of enforcement activities for a hemp program. 

 Quality of Experience: The above experience must have been comparable in scope and complexity to the class Program Specialist IV in State service. The Program Specialist IV performs the full range of program planning, development, and evaluation activities in support of an agency's program or program activities.

 Supervisory Aptitude: Supervisory aptitude rather than actual supervisory experience may be accepted. This requirement will be considered to have been met when there is strong affirmative evidence of the necessary supervisory abilities and/or potential.

 Substitutions Allowed: Relevant substitutions as described in the Minimum Qualification Requirements, will apply.

 Driver's License: A valid driver's license is required at the time of appointment.

The information provided above represents a summary of the complete Minimum Qualification Requirements. To view the Requirements in their entirety , please CLICK HERE .

Description


To assist the Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants and Resident Technical Officer (RTO) in carrying out supervision works on site.
To keep and maintain site record on progress of works, instructions given to contractors,materials delivered to site, daily activities and weather conditions at site, number of workers and visitors at site and any other significant information.
To supervise and keep records of day works.
To attend site / co-ordination meeting as directed.
To assist in enforcing the safety requirements.
To comply with Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants‚Äô Quality Assurance Procedure for construction works.
To carry out site supervision and inspection of the works including any off-site manufacturing as instructed by the Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants to ensure that the works are constructed to required quality and accuracy.
To monitor progress of the works on site and at any off-site manufacturing facilities and report delays immediately.
To provide standing supervision as and when directed by the Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants.
To maintain proper and updated daily records of all works done, including records of tests, inspections, status of works, safety, site diary, materials and equipment on site, labour,dayworks, provisional quantities, etc.
To check that contractor executes preliminaries items.
To check services routes and contractor‚Äôs setting out and report any deviations to the Authority‚Äôs appointed consultant team.
To verify reports and claims submitted by contractors.
To record all variations as instructed or approved by Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants.
To attend to Authority‚Äôs appointed contractor‚Äôs queries and co-ordinate works by Authority‚Äôs appointed main contractor and his appointed direct contractors.
To inspect and take over completed works.
To supervise and witness testing commissioning of M&E services or systems.
To provide weekly reports of site activities and problems on-site, including how they were resolved.
Attend meetings in the Authority and the Authority‚Äôs appointed consultants‚Äô offices when necessary to discuss issues arising on-site.
To familiarize with the drawings, and contract specifications and highlight deviations.
To monitor and report on the contractor‚Äôs progress and performance and maintain site records of the works which should include all circumstances and events occurring during the construction stage.
To attend TOP or CSC inspections by Registered Inspectors, BCA and all other relevant authorities‚Äô representatives for each respective discipline.
To carry out and report assessment on Construction Quality Assessment system (CONQUAS).

Preferably 5 years local supervision as a resident technical officer for Architectural, Civil, and Structural works.
Be conversant in local legislation, regulations, and codes
