About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Company Overview

With over two decades of dedication to early childhood education, Rainbow Global Education provides programs for infants and children aged 2 months to 6 years. Our curriculum and educators are tailored to meet the unique needs of each child, fostering a nurturing environment where children learn at their own pace while acquiring essential knowledge and life skills.


Our Mission: To cultivate a welcoming, supportive, and stimulating learning environment.
Our Vision: To nurture children into lifelong learners with strong moral foundations.


We firmly believe that happy teachers contribute to happy children. Therefore, we prioritize creating a familial work environment for our staff. We offer competitive remuneration packages, including medical benefits, childcare subsidies for employees, ample opportunities for training and professional development, and regular working hours from Mondays to Fridays, with minimal paperwork.

Assist in preparing teaching aids and organizing learning corners.

Assist in cleaning and disinfecting resources and toys.

Title: Full Time Sales Advisor (Marina Bay Sands)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Company Description

WE ARE MORE THAN JUST A CLOTHING BRAND; WE ARE ON A MISSION TO TRANSFORM THE FUTURE OF FASHION

Are you looking for a company that pushes the boundaries and creates a community inclusive of everyone? A shared vision beyond only us?

If you answered yes, why not join us? This could be your first step towards a new and exciting career at COS! We are now looking for Retail Sales Advisors to join our Singapore team on a full time permanent contract.

About COS: Since our launch in 2007 we have opened stores and sell online in over 40 countries worldwide. Our collection offers elevated essentials, iconic pieces and innovative design. The creative soul of the brand is visualised through our storytelling, seasonal runway shows and connect with contemporary culture to create an experience beyond the expected. From the beginning, our design ethos has always put lasting style, quality and sustainability first. Today 92% of the materials in our collection are more sustainably sourced.

Job Description

Today we are looking for a sales assistant to join our talented team in Singapore. This role will be full time for 44hours per week and includes shifts at weekends and evenings.

As a sales assistant you will have the chance to offer customers a high level of service by starting conversations, selling products at the cash desk, fitting rooms and on the shop floor, processing deliveries, stock replenishment and merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor.

Qualifications

To work as a sales assistant, previous experience in customer service and knowledge about textile materials are nice to have, but not essential. Instead, we look for people who are:


Customer focused and thinking in a commercial way
Interested in trends and fashion
Communicative, positive and open-minded
Willing to learn, adaptable and action oriented
Collaborative, inclusive and supportive
Self-motivated, confident and resilient



Additional Information

COS, alongside Arket, Monki, Weekday, Afound, & Other Stories and H&M, is one of several unique brands that make up the H&M group. The H&M Group employs over 170,000 people in 74 markets across the globe, and we are the 2nd largest fashion company in the world. Since launching COS in 2007, we have opened more than 200 stores worldwide.

At COS we love welcoming new people and work hard to provide an environment where everyone feels appreciated and valued. We celebrate individual differences and recognise the contribution that all our colleagues make, regardless of their background.

When you first join COS, you will have a full introduction, excellent training, and a team that will support you during your first days, weeks and months. In addition to this you will also receive lots of fantastic benefits including.


Employee discount across all H&M group brands
Annual Wage Supplement
16-23 days annual leave
Public holiday leave
Sick leave
Birthday Leave
Additional holiday for long service
Quarterly incentive scheme
Clothing allowance
Medical care & Accident insurance

Title: Global Community Specialist
Description Snippet:
About the job
Joining Razer will place you on a global mission to revolutionize the way the world games. Razer is a place to do great work, offering you the opportunity to make an impact globally while working across a global team located across 5 continents. Razer is also a great place to work, providing you the unique, gamer-centric experience that will put you in an accelerated growth, both personally and professionally.

Job Responsibilities

The Global Community Specialist is responsible for growing Razer‚Äôs community at an exponential rate through various content and engagement strategies. You are required to have your hands on the pulse of gaming, esports and social media trends to ensure Razer stays in the forefront of its social media game.

Given the global nature of the position, this role may be required to work evenings, weekends and odd hours to ensure successful execution of its community efforts.


Manage day-to-day communications on the social media channels of Razer (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and TikTok) to grow the engagement and size of these channels exponentially. This includes routine housekeeping, moderation, conflict resolution and enforcing of community house rules.
Create engaging, timely and relevant content across multiple social media channels to grow audience and increase engagement
Coordinate with internal marketing/product teams globally to develop and execute a social media and community strategy, which includes content/campaign planning and creation
Maintain relationships with online influencers/content creators through active outreach
Manage an up-to-date calendar of social content with regular stakeholder communications to ensure timely delivery
Conduct ongoing analysis and reporting of owned social media (and external channels) to provide industry/landscape insights as well as recommend suggestions for further improvement
Perform ad-hoc department administrative duties as required



Pre-Requisites


BA/BS degree relevant discipline such as Communications, Marketing, Digital Media or PR, or equivalent practical experience
1-2 years of experience in community management or social media marketing
Language Skills: Fluent English is a must and (favorably) an additional second language
Understanding of social media and livestreaming best practices, online marketing, and engagement techniques
Have a good eye for creative content, and the ability to spot emerging social trends and identify gaming/pop-cultural references
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, focusing on generating business results
Ability to work with global teams across multiple time zones and cultures
Must be a gamer



Good-to-have(s)


Experience in building and managing social media accounts for a brand
Experience managing external agencies and vendors
Knowledge and experience in Digital Marketing, CEO, and SEM



Are you game?

To assist the Condominium Manager in the daily operations and maintenance of the property.

Title: Customer Support Officer
Description Snippet:
About the job
A company is seeking a dedicated and empathetic Customer Support Officer to join their team.

This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and possesses excellent interpersonal skills. You will be the primary point of contact for the company's customers, providing professional support and clarification on client services and trading platforms. Additionally, you will play a crucial role in customer retention by developing and maintaining relationships with their clientele. This position offers an opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your commitment and enthusiasm will make a real difference.


Primary point of contact for customers
Opportunity to develop long-standing relationships with clientele
Dynamic, fast-paced working environment


What You'll Do

As a Customer Support Officer, you will be at the heart of the company's operations, acting as a bridge between their valued customers and various departments within the company. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include providing professional support to customers regarding the company‚Äôs services and trading platforms, clarifying any queries they may have. You'll also play a vital role in the onboarding process, liaising with Compliance and Back-Office Functions during KYC procedures. Your ability to provide multilingual support will be invaluable in this role. A key part of your role will be nurturing relationships with our client‚Äôs clientele, contributing significantly to customer retention. You'll also handle customer inquiries and complaints, ensuring they're addressed promptly and effectively.


Act as the focal point of contact between the customer and the company
Provide professional support to customers in relation to the company's service, trading platforms and other relevant applications
Clarify trading data and platform information to customers
Liaise between the Compliance department and/or Back-Office Function and the customer during account opening stages (KYC procedures)
Request and obtain necessary identification and due diligence documents from customers during onboarding process
Provide multilingual support to customers when necessary
Enhance and develop long-standing relationships with the company's clientele
Improve customer retention through effective communication and problem-solving strategies
Receive customer inquiries and complaints, ensuring they are referred to the Compliance Manager in an orderly and timely manner


What You Bring

The ideal candidate for the Customer Support Officer role is someone who brings a blend of technical knowledge, language proficiency, and interpersonal skills. You should be proficient in English and Mandarin, enabling you to provide multilingual support to our client‚Äôs diverse customer base. Your experience with KYC procedures during account opening stages will be crucial in this role. Additionally, your ability to provide professional support regarding our client‚Äôs services and trading platforms will be highly valued. A strong commitment towards improving customer retention rates is essential for success in this role. Lastly, the successful candidate will already possess CMFAS 1B and 6A qualifications.


Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to connect with diverse individuals
Proficiency in English and Mandarin languages
Experience in handling KYC procedures during account opening stages
Ability to provide professional support regarding company's services and trading platforms
Strong commitment towards improving customer retention rates
Possession of CMFAS 1B and 6A


What Sets This Company Apart

This company is renowned for its inclusive and supportive work environment that values the contribution of each team member. They believe in fostering a culture of continuous learning and development, providing ample opportunities for career progression. Our client‚Äôs commitment to diversity and inclusion is reflected in our client‚Äôs diverse workforce, which brings together individuals from different backgrounds and experiences. They also place a high emphasis on work-life balance, understanding the importance of personal time alongside professional commitments.

What's Next

If you're ready to take your career to the next level in an exciting and rewarding role, don't hesitate!

Apply today by clicking on the link!

Title: Global HR Data Management Professional I
Description Snippet:
About the job
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team



NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.



NIKE, Inc.'s uncompromising focus on human potential extends to its workforce. Nike Human Resources teams help attract, retain, and reward the world's most innovative people by creating programs to help them thrive. They accelerate company growth as stewards of culture, organizational effectiveness, talent and change. The global Human Resources community includes experts in talent planning, talent acquisition, talent development, compensation and benefits, employee relations and more. Together, they develop a motivated, diverse and engaged global team.



WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?



We are looking for a Global HR Data Management Professional I to join our Global Data Management team where you will be at the forefront of managing high-volume HR processes for our multinational organization. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and compliance of our global HR data and processes. You will tackle substantial workloads with strong critical thinking skills, embracing challenging and ambiguous situations to drive impactful outcomes. You are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, possess exceptional attention to detail, and are passionate about supporting employees worldwide.



WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?



At the core of our work, a typical day involves receiving and prioritizing requests from management and HR Partners via ServiceNow system. Your responsibilities will include creating and maintaining positions as needed, in alignment with the Strategic Workforce Planning team. You will create and maintain supervisory organizations to ensure alignment with organizational hierarchy and reporting lines. You will also play a part in all employee lifecycle events which include processing requests for leaves of absence according to company policies and relevant regulations, processing new hires and ensuring timely competition of data fields critical for smooth integration into payroll systems, handling employee transfers within the organization, managing contract extensions for fixed term employees and coordinating with managers as needed, processing changes in employee work hours, and managing termination process ensuring compliance with legal and company requirements. You will also be expected to conduct regular audits of HR data and transactional processes to ensure accuracy, compliance, and data integrity.



WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?



You will be reporting to the Global Data Management Manager and will collaborate with Data Management teams in various geos to address any data discrepancies and suggest opportunities for alignment. You will also collaborate with relevant stakeholders to address their concerns and offer appropriate guidance.



What You Bring


Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Organizational Management, Business Administration or a related field
Workday experience, specifically within the Core HR area is required. ServiceNow experience is preferred
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, and ability to communicate complex concepts to stakeholders at all levels
Flexibility and ability to balance competing priorities
Fluency in English is necessary, and additional language skills are a big plus



NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.



NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.



Benefits



Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.

Title: Incident Commander
Description Snippet:
About the job

Job Summary:

The Incident Commander will provide operational oversight and leadership and is responsible for restoring services through monitoring, identifying impact and urgency, and incident coordination with the technology organizations across different segments to reduce impact to guest and cast members. 

 

This role will work with engineers and analysts at all levels, and the Incident Commander will interact with computer and software engineers, quality control specialists, infrastructure service leads, segment technologists, executive leadership, and others to ensure service availability, increase efficiency, and establish best practices for the execution and continuous improvement of the Major Incident, Event Management, Change Management, and Problem Management processes within the DTOC. 

 

Additionally, this position will drive service improvement initiatives through proactive monitoring and enhancement actions from identified risks through analytics and problem management. The Incident Commander engineer is an active member of the service team focused on operations, ensuring the sustainability of operations by contributing to the development, testing, and evaluation of services supported. 

 

Leverage partnerships with the business, customer base, and suppliers to successfully deliver services to meet agreed-upon expectations. Provides 24x7x365 first point-of-contact for centralized incident response and recovery. Provides all core services on a priority basis and with dedicated support to ensure the success of critical events. 

 

Technology Focus 

Seasoned technologist who will identify technology and execution challenges in solutions and products offered by Architecture and Engineering teams as well as outside vendors and OEMs. 
Must be familiar with complex network topics and availability approaches in an effort to drive performance from all network operations center functions. 
Carries and maintains a relevant and up-to-date skill set in the areas of x86 hardware technology, Windows, Linux, RISC operating systems, P-Series hardware, SAN, NAS and data protection technologies. 
Must have a working knowledge of relevant WAN/LAN technologies, wireless infrastructure, DNS/DHCP, Load-Balancers, WAN Accelerators, Telephony and other network technologies. 
Must have a solid understanding of Internet technologies and availability strategies for digital platforms. 

 

Responsibilities 

Perform as the incident commander on service outage calls, orchestrating recovery activities of DTOC and other technology teams to drive fast restoration of service without added risk to the organization, providing command and control of the call 
Effectively apply Incident Analysis and Problem Analysis technique during an incident and post-incident and ensure staff apply the same 
Drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the Event, Incident, Major Incident, Request Fulfillment and Problem Management processes 
Partner with suppliers to ensure third parties fulfill their contractual obligations with regard to response, diagnosis, resolution and providing RCA-related information and data 
Identify service improvement opportunities through trend analysis, proactive techniques, and after-action reviews 
Elevate any service gaps proactively with leadership 
Participate in creating, maintaining, and regularly reviewing department procedures, operational readiness plans and posture, aimed at improving the overall availability of IT services and infrastructure components, to ensure that existing and future business availability requirements can be met. This includes compiling daily operational reports and facilitation of operational readiness calls. 
Ensure the DTOC is effectively monitoring available tools and systems for high availability and swift response to potential and actual outage situations 
During outage situations consistently provide Situation Reports in a timely fashion, ensure work streams toward resolution are clearly articulated following department procedures, and business impacts are obtained and all communicated 
Manage and provide the technical direction of the team to ensure 100% on-site coverage required to effectively support incidents, service requests, proactive health checks and HyperCare services 
Perform DR/BCP activities for critical events and emergency onsite response. 

 

Basic Qualifications: 

3+ years experience supporting converged infrastructure stacks, including: application, compute, storage and networking 
3+ years leading incident recovery with multi-disciplined geographically dispersed teams in a Fortune 500 organization 
Ability to work under pressure, meet internal and external work schedules and or deadlines and show effective time and crisis management skills 
3+ years of experience in either a large IT shared services organization or outsourced environment 
Experience with hands-on support of cloud operations with one or more: AWS, Google Cloud or Azure 
Experience supporting diverse portfolios, multiple business applications and IT services 
Experience working in a 24x7 IT operations environment. 
Demonstrated experience with Service and Event Management tools. 
Demonstrated experience in systems integration, application infrastructure support and middleware operations. 
Proven experience and understanding of root cause analysis techniques 
Proven ability to be detail, deadline, and results-oriented 
Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and encourage others 
Ability to manage competing priorities and workflow 
Vendor relationship management experience 
Comfortable working within a highly matrixed organization 
Expertise in supporting large-scale environments in a diverse culture 
Demonstrated attentiveness to detail, strong partnering skills, proactive problem-solving, and decision making skills 
Demonstrated ability to delivery work on time 

 

Preferred Qualifications: 

ITIL v3 Certification Preferred 
Kepner-Tregoe highly desired 
Experience in enterprise scale IT departments highly desired 
Current or previous technical designations in operating systems, virtualization or hardware platforms will be helpful. 




The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

Title: Management Associate
Description Snippet:
About the job

Job Description of Management Associate

The ideal candidate‚Äôs primary objective will be to assist Management in various corporate investment matters and projects with the ultimate objective of being able to take on the Investment Manager‚Äôs role. Assistance may involve different business aspects of overseeing investee performance such Human Resources, Accounting & Finance, Operations & Logistics, Procurement & Product Management, Sales & Marketing, etc. The core business of Group is to improve the Return on Investment for the portfolio of investees. As the investees are SMEs who need much assistance, there is a delicate balance between facilitation and involvement. The ideal candidate should be Service-Oriented yet Business savvy individuals who enjoy analysing business problems, have the ability and perseverance to identify and work with the investees, the right external people or offer assistance indirectly until problems are solved, Team Players who are achievers, with passion to learn, and acquire new abilities, helpful, creative, focused on results, and demonstrate courage to do challenging things right. 

 

Roles and Responsibilities

Assist the Manager in identifying corporate challenges/problems and solutions needed to achieve effective outcomes with our investees .
Act as an intermediary between the service providers and the needs of the Group‚Äôs investees.
Planning, coordinating and minuting meetings to achieve deliverables & purpose and meet deadlines.
Coordinating with departments of our investees such as Accounting, Human Resources, and Finance including Cashflow Management to ensure that all operational needs are met in line with investment objectives .
Support and assist in improving processes, enhancing concepts, brainstorming ideas, and building models.
Assist the management team of our investees in the development and implementation of Strategic Business Plans.
Perform financial analysis of the Group‚Äôs investee portfolio and offer recommendations as appropriate.
Conduct market study and competitor analysis of the Group‚Äôs investees.
Conduct market research on specific industries to identify potential opportunities for investment and providing recommendations to Management.
Assist and conduct Due Diligence, Financial Analysis and Valuations on potential M&A opportunities.
Assist by way of coordination and facilitation.
Identify and analyse HR needs of the investees in the Group on an ongoing basis.
Assist in HR matters which may include recruitment, promotion & termination, employee performance evaluations, policies & procedures, etc.
Assist in the enhancement of reports so as to be able to more effectively monitor the progress on projects and to measure performance of investees against their goals.
Assist in information gathering and presentation of historical findings as necessary.
Regularly present progress reports to Management.

 

Requirements

Relevant Internship Experience preferred
Degrees in Science, Accountancy, Finance, Business Administration/Management, Engineering are welcomed.
Possess positive & humble attitude, empathy and eagerness to learn.
Effective communicator who is able to interact effectively and build interpersonal relationships with stakeholders.
Independent self-starter who is open-minded and possesses excellent team spirit.
Critical thinker who is resourceful and passionate about creating and implementing solutions.
Naturally inquisitive, articulate, persevering and versatile.
Required language(s): English, Mandarin (to liaise with Mandarin speaking clients)

Title: Executive, Port Operations
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

The Job


 Assets Management
Maintain accurate records of GC assets.
Coordinate with other department with any T-loan request.
Ensure effective deployment of assets and inventory to Stevedore Companies.
Upkeep of assets and inventory.
 Inventory Management:
Maintain accurate records of all internal inventory items.
Monitor stock levels and reorder materials as necessary to prevent shortages.
Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.
 Receiving and Inspection:
Receive and inspect incoming resupply of materials and supplies.
Verify that ordered items match the accompanying documentation.
Report any damaged or substandard items to supervisors.
 Storage and Organization:
Efficiently store goods in designated internal storage areas, including safe storage of chemicals.
Ensure proper labelling and categorization of items for easy retrieval and replenishment.
 Distribution to Department‚Äôs sections:
Coordinate distribution of materials to various sections within the department.
Maintaining records of distribution to ensure accountability.
 Equipment Maintenance:
Maintain and inspect equipment as needed, such as emergency equipment, vehicles and tools.
Report any equipment malfunctions and expiry or safety concerns promptly.
Work with relevant stakeholders to raise service request to fix any defects.
 Communication:
Collaborate with department heads and employees to understand their supply needs.
Communicate inventory levels and supply updates to relevant stakeholders.
Assist in coordinating interdepartmental material requests.
Work closely with vendor. internal stakeholders to ensure that assets and equipment are operational.
 Documentation:
Keep accurate records of internal inventory transactions and movements.
Generate reports for management on internal inventory status and performance.
Keep track of asset utilization, maintenance and regular updating of CCTV footages.
 Procurement:
Work with relevant stakeholders to raise Purchase Request through internal procurement system.
Raise service request for maintenance and repair works required.


Job Requirement


Diploma or equivalent.
Previous experience in internal warehousing or inventory management is often preferred.
Knowledge of inventory management, procurement process and basic computer skills.
Physical fitness and the ability to lift and move heavy items.
Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping.
Strong organizational and time-management skills.


About Us

Jurong Port Pte Ltd is a port operator headquartered in Singapore. Jurong Port, which operates the only multi-purpose port in Singapore, handles bulk, break-bulk and containerised cargo. It handled over 40,000 vessel-calls annually in 2019.

The port owns and operates its own subzone located in the town of Jurong East in Singapore. It is bounded by Jalan Ahmad Ibrahim, Jurong Pier Road, Jurong Island Highway, Seraya Avenue and Sugnei Jurong, including Pulau Damar Laut.

Organization

Jurong Port Pte Ltd is a port operator headquartered in Singapore. Jurong Port, which operates the only multi-purpose port in Singapore, handles bulk, break-bulk and containerised cargo. It handled over 40,000 vessel-calls annually in 2019.

The port owns and operates its own subzone located in the town of Jurong East in Singapore. It is bounded by Jalan Ahmad Ibrahim, Jurong Pier Road, Jurong Island Highway, Seraya Avenue and Sugnei Jurong, including Pulau Damar Laut.

Jurong Port has served Singapore for more than 50 years as the main point of entry to our island state, building up extensive experience and becoming the world‚Äôs leading port operator in handling general, bulk and containerised cargo.

Moving forward, we aspire to develop the next generation multipurpose port by offering a full range of high-value maritime port services that will be second to none‚Äîa port that anticipates changing cargo and importation needs, one that grows in sophistication as well as in effectiveness to deliver value-for-money, timely service to our port users today, and in the future.

Title: LLM Performance Operation-Specialist
Description Snippet:
About the job
Responsibilities

About ByteDance

Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About The Team

Join our LLM Global Data Team as a core member and be at the heart of our innovative operations. You'll gain invaluable experience in deciphering and enhancing the performance of LLMs across various metrics.

Your Role Will Involve


 Acquire hands-on experience in measuring the performance of LLM and related products, including the design and execution of tests.
 Assist in the development of automated evaluation and testing processes.
 Work closely with product managers and analysts, engaging with external experts and partners to bolster our performance analysis initiatives.



Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:


 Strong command of English, with outstanding writing and analytical skills.
 Proficiency in critical thinking and establishing frameworks for performance assessment.
 Intelligent and meticulous individuals adept at content comparison and analysis within set frameworks.
 Ability to meet tight deadlines while maintaining a keen eye for detail.
 A profound interest in the world of Large Language Models (LLMs).



Preferred Qualifications


 Prior experience in evaluating NLP models and search product performance is highly desirable.



Please note: Candidates will be required to complete a written assessment before proceeding to the interview stage.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Survey Engineer
Description Snippet:
About the job

UTEC, part of Acteon Group, is one of the world's largest independent offshore and onshore survey providers. We provide a wide range of survey, positioning and data management services using the most advanced equipment and techniques. The data we generate provides our clients with the information they need to make critical, well informed, business decisions.




UTEC is currently seeking to hire a Survey Engineer on a full-time, permanent basis for their Offshore team in Singapore.




The Senior Survey Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all engineering work carried out on site is conducted in the best interests of UTEC and the Client and meets all project safety, contractual and quality requirements. The Senior Survey Engineer shall also ensure that all equipment received to the vessel is configured correctly and calibrations and certification is kept up to date.




Duties/Responsibilities

Experience of all types of Survey sensors used across a different range of job/operation
Ability to understand sensor pinout/wiring diagrams, how to interface equipment and sensors through survey vehicles into the online system
Understanding of basic electronics, demonstrate understanding of commonly used electronic symbols and wiring principles
Knowledge and understanding of IT and general networking solutions. How to setup a dedicated survey network and interface survey sensors to online
Good knowledge of different data protocols used with survey sensors, serial 232, 422, 485 protocols, ethernet comms, fibre optic
Experience of CCTV and video systems. Setting up video distribution on board vessels
Ability to problem solve and fault find issues with equipment. Demonstrate good problem-solving practices and show common sense logical thinking to identify problems
Ability to make up and terminate all types of cabling, using specific tools, for interfacing, antenna cabling, network cabling, serial cabling, video cabling, ROV/survey sensor cabling
Ability to create vessel wiring diagrams, setup notes in relevant software packages
Maintain, service, calibrate equipment used in offshore survey operations
Keep vessel inventories, manifests, equipment certification up to date
Knowledge of data storage systems
Knowledge of online software packages, interfacing survey sensors to online systems and testing




 Requirements 

Education in Electronics/Electrical/Mechatronics degree are desired
Relevant industry experience is essential in an offshore survey in a Senior Survey Engineer role
Technical understanding and knowledge of major survey equipment and software used in the offshore survey sector
Excellent Written and Verbal communication skills
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work in a team environment
Able to work Online back-to-back with that Surveyor in case required
Fully vaccinated against COVID-19, having received both initial jabs and booster shots

Title: Executive, Ticketing Operations
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Function




The Ticketing Operations Team holds the key role in liaising with multiple departments and vendors to ensure the smooth delivery for all ticketed attractions (ArtScience Museum, Digital Light Canvas, SkyPark and Sampan Boat Rides) and events (Theatre Shows and MICE Events) in Marina Bay Sands.




The team is also responsible for the coordination and configuration of the ticket sales requirements of these above-mentioned events and conduct analysis on ticketing data.




Responsibilities




Stakeholders Management 




Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to prepare for on sales.
Manage timelines and maintain clear communications with stakeholders as candidate will be handling multiple events with competing deadlines.
Prepare/ Draft Standard of Procedures (SOPs) and training guides.
Must be comfortable communicating with stakeholders of different levels of authority.




Tickets Configuration




Responsible for configuring events accurately into the ticketing system.
Work closely with internal teams to ensure smooth delivery of ticket sales for different sales channels with different requirements (eg: Box Office, Call Centre, Ticketing Kiosks, and Internet).
Assist in re-configuration if any additional changes/requirements are needed.
Manage seat inventory for events and ensure that stakeholders‚Äô requirements are being catered for.
Resolve any issues that might occur and propose workarounds or solutions for future tickets build.




Reporting and Data Analysis




Preparation of postmortem reports, overall ticketing sales reports and account settlement.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by maintaining up to date records of event sales.
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly reports as required.
Liaise with various departments including Finance, ArtScience Museum, Attractions, Front-of-House, Marketing, MICE to communicate events and reports requirements.
Revenue analysis as directed by Managers or stakeholders and make recommendations regarding forecasting and budget planning.




Requirements




Candidates should have at least a Diploma or Degree in Business Administration, Events Management, Hospitality, or another related field.
Minimum 2 years work experience in similar capacity.
Ability to respond with flexibility and resilience when faced with multiple requests, projects, and rapid changes.
Highly meticulous and detail oriented as candidate will need to check sales, revenue, ticketing data.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Well verse in Microsoft Office applications.
Knowledge of Microsoft Illustrator and/or Photoshop would be an advantage.
Independent, self-motivated and team player.
Candidate should be comfortable and accommodate to the extended working hours on event days i.e. weekday evenings, weekends and public holidays if required.
Needs to be responsive via phone to resolve issues that might occur during non-working hours.




Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Title: Operations Specialist
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

The Job

Operational Responsibilities


Monitor port operations and enforce cargo processes to ensure vessel productivity and optimal resource allocation, achieving recommended cargo handling productivity rates.
Communicate, control, and troubleshoot all port operations flow and issues within the assigned sector.
Liaise with vessel crew regarding safety and operational matters related to the vessel.
Conduct checks and facilitate the handover/takeover of the wharf between stevedore companies and relevant departments.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records/documents across multiple platforms pertaining to the overall cargo operations of the vessel.
Promptly communicate and update information related to vessel activities, including operational progress and any disruptions or stoppages.
Communicate with stevedore vessel checkers and foremen‚Äôs gang regarding any matters related to cargo operations.


Safety Responsibilities


Oversee cargo handling operations and ensure compliance with safety requirements.
Conduct thorough checks on gang workers‚Äô passes and verify the validity of equipment certificates.
Review submitted checklists to confirm accurate completion and documentation of necessary safety procedures, equipment checks, and protocols.
Review Method Statements, Risk Assessments, and Lifting Plans to ensure alignment with safety requirements.
Conduct incident investigations and prepare reports on accidents, near-miss incidents, and safety violations.
Maintain accurate records of safety inspections, incidents, and corrective actions taken.


Other Responsibilities


Perform other administrative duties and handle ad-hoc tasks as instructed by supervisors.
Stay updated on industry best practices, emerging trends, and safety guidelines while proactively incorporating them into daily operations.


Job Requirement


Minimum ITE educational qualification.
Strong knowledge of port operations, cargo handling, and vessel operations would be an added advantage.
Candidates with no prior experience are welcome to apply.
Proficient in computer skills and basic software applications.
Possession of a valid Class 3 Driving License.
Possession of relevant safety certificates would be preferrable.
WSQ Supervise Safe Lifting Operations
WSQ Perform Rigger & Signalman Tasks
WSQ Respond to Fire & HazMat Emergency
WSQ Certificate in Workplace Safety and Health (Level A)
Occupational First Aid 
Manage/Perform Work at Height
Willingness to work in 12-hour shift duties.
Ability to work independently, prioritise tasks effectively, and adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environment.

About Us

Jurong Port Pte Ltd is a port operator headquartered in Singapore. Jurong Port, which operates the only multi-purpose port in Singapore, handles bulk, break-bulk and containerised cargo. It handled over 40,000 vessel-calls annually in 2019.

The port owns and operates its own subzone located in the town of Jurong East in Singapore. It is bounded by Jalan Ahmad Ibrahim, Jurong Pier Road, Jurong Island Highway, Seraya Avenue and Sugnei Jurong, including Pulau Damar Laut.

Organization

Jurong Port Pte Ltd is a port operator headquartered in Singapore. Jurong Port, which operates the only multi-purpose port in Singapore, handles bulk, break-bulk and containerised cargo. It handled over 40,000 vessel-calls annually in 2019.

The port owns and operates its own subzone located in the town of Jurong East in Singapore. It is bounded by Jalan Ahmad Ibrahim, Jurong Pier Road, Jurong Island Highway, Seraya Avenue and Sugnei Jurong, including Pulau Damar Laut.

Jurong Port has served Singapore for more than 50 years as the main point of entry to our island state, building up extensive experience and becoming the world‚Äôs leading port operator in handling general, bulk and containerised cargo.

Moving forward, we aspire to develop the next generation multipurpose port by offering a full range of high-value maritime port services that will be second to none‚Äîa port that anticipates changing cargo and importation needs, one that grows in sophistication as well as in effectiveness to deliver value-for-money, timely service to our port users today, and in the future.

Title: Junior Broker (Thai Speaking)
Description Snippet:
About the job

Job Purpose:

To facilitate the prompt placement of reinsurance contracts in accordance with the client‚Äôs requirements and needs, in a timely manner in accordance with regulatory requirements acting in the best interest of the client at all times.
To provide a quality service to clients covering all aspects of their insurance arrangements; to advise, arrange and secure the appropriate cover at a competitive premium.
Providing support to the Accident and Health Broking Team in the preparation of placement slips & endorsements and placing process, and to work on allocated tasks and projects as directed in order to facilitate the business operations.
Understand the workings of the company and each of its functions, as well as the market that the business operates in.




Main Responsibilities:

To manage the reinsurance intermediation as part of the team including production, risk placing, client servicing, claims handling and associated functions.
To produce clear and accurate documents and wordings for clients which provide the best possible cover in the market and adhere to all regulatory requirements.
Use appropriate class of business knowledge to produce contract documents and documents suited to the client‚Äôs needs.
Check and recommend amendments to policies/contract documents produced by others prior to agreement by Underwriters.
Check final contract documents against slip or proposal details to ensure appropriateness of the proposed standard policy.
Create original and complex contract documents and maintain database of contract documents and policy information.
Provide advice on contract documents within specified classes of business.
Resolve Underwriter‚Äôs queries in a timely manner.
Learn the use of GXB, and help drive and encourage adoption of it throughout Price Forbes and to ensure that Tracking is completed promptly to reflect the status of any risk.

To exercise judgement when reviewing proposals, either new or renewals.
Maintain up-to-date and orderly files, and ensure documents are saved and files are passed on to the others in accordance with Company Rules and Procedures.
Work closely with Finance and Technical Processing department in resolving accounting and technical queries.
Provide and gather information to and from Clients, Underwriters, Brokers, and Technical Processing Colleagues as required.
Manage and undertake assigned project work to time scales as directed.
Evaluate workflow system and policy status and report on regular basis.
Facilitate KYC compliance checks as relevant.
Calling on prospects and clients for new business opportunities.
Maintain proper meeting and call records.




Client Service:

Understand the insurance cover of each client and provide pro-active service to expedite the production of policies, liaising between all parties and actively chasing information.
Provide pro-active service to expedite the production of policies, liaising between all parties and actively chasing information.
Deal with all client queries in a timely and professional manner.

 

 

Essentials:

Diploma holder or equivalent.
Minimum 2 years A&H Facultative technical experience in a Reinsurance Broking firm. 
Ability to speak and read Thai including Thai-English translation, fluent in English.
Ability to prioritize and organize own workload.
Ability to work under pressure without supervision.
Collaborative team working approach.
Ability to work with employees at all organizational levels.
Ability to develop and sustain relationships with both internal and external parties.
Accurate and attentive to detail.
Good written and verbal skills.
Proficiency in MS Outlook (email).
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).

Title: Finance Associate
Description Snippet:
About the job

We are seeking a detail-oriented Finance Associate to support various financial activities within our organization. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment. As a Finance Associate, you will assist in partner management, invoice and quotation issuance, pricing review, support for new initiatives, supplier management, accounting and corporate secretary coordination, reporting, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.




Responsibilities:

Accounting and Corporate Secretary Coordination:

Assist in coordinating with accounting firm as needed to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Compute gross monthly salary, bonus, allowance, claims, deductions for payroll.
Process payments and handle CPF submissions for payroll.
Prepare and submit Annual Auto-Inclusion Scheme (AIS) submissions to IRAS.
Manage insurance-related matters.
Assist in preparing and submitting Gov grants.

Invoice Issuance:

Assist in issuing monthly invoices and ad-hoc invoices as required.
Support the submission of e-invoices via Vendors@Gov for government organizations

Suppliers Management:

Support supplier relationships, including issuing purchase orders, processing invoices, and managing payments on a monthly basis and as needed.

Partner Management:

Assist in maintaining relationships with partners to ensure effective financial management.

Reporting:

Assist in preparing ad-hoc financial reports as required, including cash flow forecasts and profit and loss updates.

Quotation Issuance:

Assist the team in the preparation and issuance of quotations to support business operations.

Pricing Review:

Support the team in conducting regular reviews of pricing structures, including renewals and increments, to ensure competitiveness and profitability.

Corporate Information Management:

Assist in managing financial data and corporate information efficiently and accurately.

Support for New Initiatives:

Provide financial support for new programs, business proposals, and tender proposals, including financial analysis and budgeting.

Review Financial Statements:

Assist in reviewing and analyzing financial statements on an annual basis, ensuring accuracy and compliance with accounting standards




Who we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of working experience in similar positions.
Proven interest in financial management and analysis.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in financial software and MS Office suite.
Knowledge of government invoicing procedures and regulations is a plus.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organisational, problem-solving and time management skills
Key attributes required are autonomy, accountability, task-oriented focus, and adeptness in multitasking.
Only Singaporeans or PRs need to apply.




ABOUT - RED ALPHA CYBERSECURITY

As a cybersecurity talent development company, we believe that cybersecurity is not just a profession, it is a mission. This propels our dedication to transforming aspiring individuals who can contribute towards building a safer cyberspace. Inclusivity and diversity is at the heart of our mission. We are committed to empowering trainees from diverse backgrounds and creating a supportive learning environment that enables everyone to excel. Our ultimate goal is to build a more resilient and robust cybersecurity workforce.

Title: Managing Principal - Data & Tech
Description Snippet:
About the job

MANAGING PRINCIPAL ‚Äì DATA & TECHNOLOGY




Singapore




ABOUT CAPCO




Capco, a Wipro company, is a global technology and management consultancy specializing in driving digital transformation in the financial services industry. With a growing client portfolio comprising of over 100 global organizations, Capco operates at the intersection of business and technology by combining innovative thinking with unrivalled industry knowledge to deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions and fast-track digital initiatives for banking and payments, capital markets, wealth and asset management, insurance, and the energy sector. Capco‚Äôs cutting-edge ingenuity is brought to life through its Innovation Labs and award-winning be Yourself At Work culture and diverse talent.




We are/have:




We are experts in Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth and Asset Management.
We are rapidly expanding our Insurance sector capability.
We specialise in Digital Transformation, Data Management & Data Analytics, Business & Finance Transformation engagements, and IT transformation and Change programmes.
We are committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent in the market.
Our focus is on maintaining our agile and entrepreneurial culture.




OUR DATA & TECH TEAM




Capco‚Äôs Data & Tech Team helps our clients transform every aspect of their business. We are highly skilled at formulating data strategy and defining business and technology initiatives across the data management lifecycle; we provide expertise in technical delivery, architecture, and change; we focus on new digital ventures, cloud-native initiatives, and devops-enabled agile delivery to bring real change to our clients.




As digital technologies advance and regulations tighten, today‚Äôs consumers ‚Äì and, therefore, today‚Äôs businesses ‚Äì are becoming more aware of the importance of good quality data and forward-looking technology. We pride ourselves in helping our clients transform their own delivery capabilities ‚Äì assessing, improving, and delivering cutting-edge solutions for financial services clients.




RESPONSIBILITIES




As a Managing Principal at Capco, you will be playing a key role in the delivery of projects, working on client sites to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading Local and MNCs across the Financial Services and Insurance sectors.




Key for this role is there is requirement to have a background in Financial Services or Insurance within one of our core capability areas:




Digital Transformation
Data Strategy, Data Management & Data Analytics
Business & Finance Transformation
IT Transformation




We are keen to bring on those from a consulting background in BFSI industries that can apply their perspectives and techniques to our core sectors and capability.




We are looking for exceptional talent with the following:




Strong interpersonal and influencing skills; the ability to interact with colleagues at all levels and achieve goals without direct control over resources.
Having a strong commercial focus, the ability to develop client relationships, and lead sales opportunities and data/tech propositions.
Ability build market networks and relationships to enhance the market awareness of the SG Data & Tech practice.
Engaging with technical and non-technical audiences to deliver change initiatives for leading clients across financial services, including investment banking, retail banking, wealth, and insurance. 
Strong emerging end-to-end generalist problem solving skills, e.g., defining, and deconstructing problems.
Extensive project and people management experience and ability to deliver and manage projects and individuals workstreams.




SKILLS AND EXPERTISE




Diverse problem-solving experience, such as experience with a top management consulting firm or in other generalist problem solving environments across the Financial Services and/or Insurance sectors.
Understanding of data & analytics concepts e.g., Data Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Ethics Lineage, Data Models, Data Quality, Data Analysis, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Data Literacy.
A good understanding of modern, cloud-based technology architecture.
An outstanding ability to think strategically, execute tactically, and enable cross-business and cross-functional teams.
Experience and capabilities to communicate with client leaders to influence direction and manage expectations, and excellent project and people management skills. 
Strong understanding of Agile ways of working would be an advantage.




WHY CAPCO? 




We are expanding our business rapidly across Singapore and Asia. You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banking and insurance clients in the world, projects that will deliver significant transformation and change.




We offer:




You will join a company that supports and encourages an entrepreneurial outlook and independent thinking. Capco is not about organizational charts and layers ‚Äì we operate with little hierarchy because we want all employees to feel that Capco is their firm. We warmly value diversity and inclusion and embrace our collective uniqueness ‚Äì our culture is a strong, fresh, and invigorating difference from our competitors.




We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical and dental insurance and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.

Title: Principal Investment Operations Specialist - Finance(Based in Beijing, China)
Trainee Average Adjuster
Description Snippet:
About the job
Role Overview


Charles Taylor Adjusting / Richards Hogg Lindley is a service-based company and our prime objective is to provide an expedient, comprehensive and technically competent professional service in response to the instructions from national and international insurance companies to handle claims. We provide average adjusting services that cover all levels of loss - no matter how complex or large. Globally, we have the largest team of average adjusters to assist our clients.

The role is desk based where the average adjusters will incorporate their findings into adjustments of claims, compiled in a format which offers an objective and concise analysis of each loss. You will be receiving trainings on the fundamentals of marine insurance and insurance policies, assisting senior adjusters with interpretation of survey reports, etc. as part of cause analysis and costs assessment. This will involve the collating and analysis of claim supporting documents to validate the repair costs and provide settlement proposals by preparing an adjustment of claim in accordance with the terms and conditions of the insurance policies. You may be assigned or work with senior or other group office adjusting team.

Average adjusters are experts in marine insurance and law, who may be appointed by any party in a marine claim or dispute. Irrespective of the identity of the instructing party, the average adjuster is bound to act in an impartial and independent manner. By experience and training, average adjusters are therefore problem-solvers and mediators.

The duty of an average adjuster is to act fairly to all parties to the contract of insurance or contracts of carriage, to set down all relevant material facts, to present the figures of the suggested settlement in such a manner as to be capable of being easily grasped, and above all, in all cases wherever definite law or practice is not clear, to place the matter before the parties interested in such a manner as to facilitate an settlement agreement between them.

With the progression of career, the right candidate may have the opportunities to spend some time working in our UK/Middle East/Greater China offices.

Charles Taylor Adjusting / Richards Hogg Lindley is committed to the development of the next generation of average adjusters. Our goal is to provide the successful candidate with market leading training for a successful career in average adjusting. We fully support our average adjusters to obtaining professional qualification from the UK Association of the Average Adjusters. We offer hybrid working and a modern office environment.

Key Responsibilities

1. To perform a loss adjusting function in respect of new claims and those already handled in the offices which have been delegated by directors or senior adjusters. This will involve, but not be limited to: -

- Receiving and acknowledging new claims instructions.

- Managing and coordinating claims in a timely and professional manner within agreed Service Level Agreements.

- Undertaking meeting with Insurers, Reinsurers, Brokers, Claimants, Insureds and other interested parties as required.

- Preparing preliminary reports commenting in detail on all aspects of the claim including legal and policy liability considerations, potential quantum and future actions.

- Instructing and controlling surveyors, lawyers, forensic scientists and other engineering experts as necessary.

- Communicating regularly with all interested parties, calculating claim reserves, preparing interim reports and other communications.

- Calculating, negotiating and recommending settlement of claims, and preparing accurate final adjustments of claims.

2. To assist in and develop the effective marketing of Charles Taylor Adjusting / Richards Hogg Lindley and a client network. This will include, but not be limited to: -

- Developing working relationships with existing Clients.

- Helping to identify and plan approaches to new Clients.

- Hosting and attending networking events outside of office hours.

- Assisting in the preparation and delivery of presentations and tenders to Clients and potential Clients.

- Assisting others within Charles Taylor with their marketing functions.

- Demonstrate and champion Charles Taylor Values by ensuring Agility, Integrity, Care, and Accountability and Collaboration.

3. Ad Hoc duties: Your key accountabilities will include such other duties and tasks as allocated, at the discretion of management, and that are within your capabilities and the scope of your role.

Required Skills

We are seeking a self-motivated individual to join our marine team as a Trainee Average Adjuster. The requirements are:

Essential 



University graduate, preferably in Maritime / Maritime Law / Marine Insurance related subject
0-3 years of relevant post-graduate industry experience in the Maritime, Maritime Law, Marine Insurance broking, underwriting, claims or other relevant sectors
Previous adjusting or surveying experience would be an advantage.
Strong analytical mind with an attention to detail
Strong interpersonal skills and excellent communication and with good level of English proficiency.
Proficiency in second Asian language would be beneficial.
Good IT skills (proficiency in Excel essential)
Able to travel overseas occasionally.

Title: ML Specialist, Trust and Safety
Description Snippet:
About the job

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 




Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 

Join us.




Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.




Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.




As an ML Specialist, you will be responsible for training our global AI models (CV, OCR, NLP, Audio, Multimodel) to ensure accurate and efficient detection of unsafe content. You will work with the algorithm engineers, the data labelling team and the product & process team to design and improve machine learning model operation processes. This role is crucial in ensuring the quality and relevancy of input into the model which will impact the overall safety of our users.




Responsibilities:

1. Manage and optimise DataOps procedures, ensuring standardisation and stability of features for model lifecycle operation.

2. Automate and maintain the model training pipeline to ensure effective and efficient MLOps processes.

3. Implement and oversee auto-parameter tuning methods to optimise machine learning models.

4. Collaborate with algo R&D and engineers to understand and implement complex ML frameworks.

5. Monitor and report on model performance, identify areas for improvement and implement necessary adjustments via solid root causes analyses.

6. Establish MLOps policies and ensure their adherence across all data and ML initiatives.

7. Troubleshoot moderation system issues through effectively communicating technical/business details to various stakeholders.




Qualifications

1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Data Analytics or a related field. An advanced degree(Master's, PhD) is preferred.

2. Extensive experience in machine learning, data science, and data governance. Proven experience in implementing MLOps or DataOps processes is a plus.

3. Passionate about technology, product and innovation; Solid knowledge of ML models (e.g. CV, NLP, OCR, Audio, Multimodel) and frameworks(e.g. few-shot learning, active learning etc); Proficiency in SQL and Python; Prior experience with pre-trained models like CLIP is a plus.

4. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

5. Good communication skills and enjoy working with diverse teams globally.




TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Chartering Operations Officer

About the job
Job description:



Summary:
As a Chartering Operations Officer, you will be part of the Chartering, Sale & Purchase department‚Äôs Asian Marine & Operations branch that observes the contractual, regulatory, technical and energetic performance of chartered vessels and ensures their efficient and continuous utilization by the CMA CGM Group's commercial lines operating out of Asia.

You will also act as an entry point for CMA CGM to shipowners and their representatives to coordinate and organize the chartered vessels‚Äô life in the group‚Äôs fleet over the duration of its charter contract. Responsible for a determined part of the chartered fleet, you will also be the privileged interlocutor for our Asian commercial lines who operate the vessels of your fleet, and further for all stakeholders on the group for topics relating to operational availability, performance, CII, maintenance, necessary repairs, possible improvements, litigation etc.

You will use the specific tools and databases of the Chartering department and will be responsible for keeping them updated for your scope.

Main Responsibilities:

Actively monitor and coordinate charter duration within the CMA CGM fleet

Individual with vessel operations experience and/or chartering preferred
Knowledge in maritime regulations and the legal framework would be advantageous 

 

**This role is open for local employment only

We will only consider applicants who have received, or are willing to receive by the date of recruitment, the full regimen of a WHO EUL vaccine (examples include Pfizer-BioNTech/COMIRNATY, Moderna, Sinovac-CoronaVac, and AstraZeneca). Proof of vaccination will be required.

**Kindly note that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.
** By applying for this role, you hereby consent to the CMA CGM Group collecting, processing and using any personal information you submit, for the following purposes:
(i) To process the application for the role being applied for;

(iii) To conduct necessary reference checks; and
(iv) Any other purpose related to one or more of the above.

You further consent to the CMA CGM Group retaining such personal information for a period of two years following your submission thereof, so that we may consider you for other open positions within the CMA CGM Group which may be suitable to you in the event that you are not selected for this role.

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that CMA CGM Group does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, CMA CGM Group will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. Title: Operations Analyst
Description Snippet:
About the job
Vonage Mission

We strive to innovate and enhance our customers' ability to communicate within today's digital, cloud and real-time business environment. Our sales team is composed of highly-motivated, energetic and customer-focused Team Members that expand existing accounts/channels and find new clients for company products and services.

Why this role matters

The CM Operations team, which sits within the Vonage API sales organisation, is responsible for driving the revenue and margin growth of the international messaging business. The team supports one of the fastest growing CPaaS companies in the market, directly managing our OTT and wholesale customer base, whilst working closely with our Carrier and Enterprise sales teams to develop and implement regional strategy plans.

As a high-growth team delivering over 100% growth in the last two years, expansion is needed to ensure continued success. Analytics - Opportunity-hunting, traffic trending and tracking, to ensure growth and safeguard against churn. Working with large data sets to extract useful information for internal teams and/or customers.
Testing - Running manual and automated quality tests when necessary
Pricing - Management of trading pricing decks and building bespoke pricing plans for key partners and OTT customers. 


What Will You Bring


A robust results driven mindset and dynamic approach.

What Is In It For You

In addition to providing exciting work, career advancement opportunities, and a collaborative work environment, Vonage provides competitive pay and benefits including unlimited discretionary time off and tuition reimbursement.

Title: Originator Hydrocarbons, APAC
Description Snippet:
About the job

Phillips 66 & YOU - Together we can fuel the future




Phillips 66 has more than 140 years of experience in providing the energy that enables people to dream bigger and go farther, faster. We are committed to improving lives, and that is our promise to our employees and our communities. We are sustained by the backgrounds and experiences of our diverse teams, which reflect who we are, the environment we create and how we work together. Our company is built on values of safety, honor and commitment. We call our cultural mindset Our Energy in Action, which we define through four simple, intuitive behaviors: We work for the greater good, create an environment of trust, seek different perspectives and achieve excellence. Phillips 66 was recognized by Forbes as one of ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs Best Employers‚Äù in 2021.




Learn more about Phillips 66 by visiting phillips66.com/about.

 

 

Purpose:

 

In order to continue the development of world class Commercial Supply and Trading organization, Phillips 66 Origination must consistently be a leading player with third party producers and consumers in the hydrocarbons and renewable energy markets, as well as a critical player in logistics to develop, maintain and optimize physical flows for third party trading and Phillips 66 supply needs. 




 The Originator Hydrocarbons, APAC plays a vital role in developing complex and longer-term opportunities throughout the APAC Region for Phillips 66 global hydrocarbons including crude business. These transactions will be marketed to third parties and can involve a combination of physical, risk management and financial elements. This is a Singapore-based role with travel needed to collaborate with Phillips 66 teams in Calgary, Houston and London. The incumbent will be an active member and participant of the crude team based in Singapore and interact with the crude teams in Canada, London and Houston, and will be responsible for liaising with the Global Commercial Origination team on cross-commodity opportunities. 

 




 Key accountabilities:

Develops and leads negotiation strategies to deliver commercial and operational agreements and complex transactions, creating optimization and cross-commodity sales opportunities where appropriate, in the APAC crude markets, with particular focus in China.
Drives business development (prospecting, originating and executing), working with and in support of Crude traders, by identifying, appraising, optimising, developing and closing transactions that add flexibility and optionality to the portfolio
Builds a robust network of opportunities that enables commercial delivery 
Provides deal assurance by ensuring transaction structures, execution options, negotiating and relationship management tactics, risks, rewards and resources are considered, defined and evaluated
Maintains full understanding of how each new business opportunity impacts trading exposures associated with our portfolio
Builds and maintains strategic relationships with internal teams and external parties including customers, government bodies and regulators
Uses deep market knowledge and relationships to drive intel of market events and activities 

 

 

Required Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree with 5 or more years of experience in hydrocarbons origination or trading
Strong background in delivery of strategic commercial deals in oil and gas ‚Äì with evidence of origination of physical flows, logistics optimization and structured finance
Strong relationships and external networks, particularly with upstream producers in the core oil and gas markets
Ability to work autonomously, while building relationships across business partners to ensure active deal management and sponsorship
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem solving skills, and high level of financial understanding
Strong negotiation capabilities, evidenced by prior commercial deals/transactions in the industry
Ability to work with, and develop relationships with, third party financiers (banks, PE, credit funds)
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Track record of commercial delivery and experience
Ability to lead and motivate multi-disciplinary teams in a respectful manner
Desire and ability to work closely with trading desks, and cross business and cross region/location teams, as well as drive collaborative opportunities where relevant
Ability to engage at all levels of an organization and represent Phillips 66 externally
Required to travel regularly, up to 50% of time

 

Phillips 66 International Trading Pte Ltd adopts the Tripartite Standards and is committed to be a fair and progressive employer.

Title: Advisory Strategist, Cloud Transformation Office
Description Snippet:
About the job
Please Note:



 If you are a first time user, please create your candidate login account before you apply for a job. (Click Sign In > Create Account)
 If you already have a Candidate Account, please Sign-In before you apply.



Job Description:

Job Overview

Advisory, part of the APAC Cloud Transformation Office (CTO), collaborates with our major customers to create transformation strategies and business cases. With former C-Level and industry consultants in our ranks, we're authorities on uncovering hidden barriers, finding opportunities and formulating meaningful IT transformation plans. The team exclusively engages Directors, Vice Presidents and C-Level executives in our most strategic Enterprise Customers to help them navigate the people, process and technology challenges of Digital Transformation.

The Advisory team works closely with strategic account teams, pre-sales, architects, professional services, and sales leadership. The role reports to the APAC Advisory leader. The main focus is ASIA markets, however also includes supporting strategic opportunities across the Asia Pacific. You'll promote adoption of VMware by Broadcom solutions into the Strategy segment of Broadcom Business. This exciting strategic role combines the competencies of strategy consulting, executive engagement, deal structuring and leading projects.

Responsibilities

Customer advisory and relationship building



As an Advisory strategist, you'll foster business relationships with customer executives, both business and technical so that you can map solutions to customer needs.
Lead executive workshops on business and IT strategy and transformation, operational readiness and change management
Passionate about new technologies and sharing how adoption of these new technologies can promote positive business transformation
Manage own time and engagements to ensure successful outcomes 



Expertise and practice development



Develop insights on essential topics like industry/customer research, strategy, transformation, financial analysis and benchmarking
Spread the best processes among functions and teams; lead strategic direction with customers
Advise account teams on customer business issues and support account planning 



Requirements



More than 10 years' experience in an Advisory role or similar customer leadership roles
Previous direct experience with VMware by Broadcom solutions and associated technologies (Engineer, Developer, Architect, Administrator, Team Leader, or Operator)
Established experience with Enterprise and Solution Architecture Frameworks
Record of building customer relationships and ability to have meaningful conversations with C-Level audiences
Present well in front of large and small audiences; ability to abstract and communicate on complex topics
Have had a role related to one or several markets (i.e. public sector, financial services, telecommunications)
Experience with the financial, operational and technical challenges faced with running modern day IT operations at large corporations
Knowledge of IT-Architectures on the infrastructure and software development side
Comprehensive industry knowledge that can be leveraged to establish compelling roadmaps for customers
Flexibility to travel 40% of time and able to perform well in intense conditions
Financial and Organisational Skills (financial accounting, return on investment, value realisation, total cost of ownership, budget planning, organisational design)
Technical and business writing skills (white papers, outstanding responses and proposals)
Languages: English at professional level (other languages beneficial but not mandatory) 



We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
