Title: Data Center Operations Logistics Engineer
Description Snippet:
About the job
The Leaseweb APAC team is growing quickly and looking for talented colleagues to join us. 

Are you passionate about logistics in combination with IT and hardware? Are you a hands-on and technology-driven logistics engineer? Are you energetic and able to get things done? Then you should apply with us! 

Everybody at Leaseweb is responsible for high customer satisfaction. We give our customers a royal treatment. Our data center Operations Team is involved in the daily management of our current 6 data center facilities in the APAC region (Singapore, Japan, Hong Kong and Australia) and we are about to open 3 more data center location in Singapore, Japan and Australia later this year. This includes the deployment and support of hardware and hosting services for our end users. The data center Operations Logistics Engineer plays a key role in the day to day operations. 

This is a logistics-focused role in Singapore, where warehouse management, order picking, inbound/outbound goods and return material authorization come together. As a large hosting provider, there is a strong affinity for servers, hardware and network equipment. Knowledge or affinity with these products is a prerequisite. The work environment is dynamic and has an international character.‚ÄØ As a Data Center Operations Logistics Engineer, you will work 8 hours a day Monday to Friday, between 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. On request you have to start your workday early to support our operations in Australia and Japan if needed.

You will report to the Data center Operations Team Manager.

Key responsibilities: 


You will manage the inventory of received and distributed servers, server components, network equipment, power equipment, and other computer hardware in order to deliver the services sold to the customer. This requires physical work (e.g., transporting servers).
Ensures that the quantity and quality of incoming and outgoing shipments are correct.
Maintains controls over various types of inventory (servers, server components, network equipment, power equipment, etc.
Enforces high standards of inventory management. Including sorting and handling of equipment returned from the data center
Execute order picking based on production orders (service orders) in a timely manner in accordance with the set delivery times in SAP
Execute shipments to internal and external customers in accordance with the set delivery deadlines
Create Return Material Authorization requests to vendors for return of broken equipment.
Clean up configurations and update firmware on power and network equipment following a guided process with detailed instructions.
Does regular stock and periodical cycle counts of the warehouse



Requirements: 


At least two years experience in logistics/inventory environment. 
Strong Work Ethic‚ÄØand sense of responsibility
Professional and effective communication‚ÄØ in English
Problem solver and taking ownership
Ability to travel internationally to other data centers, as needed. 
It would be a plus if you could speak Mandarin, Cantonese and/or Japanese to liase with customers & stakeholders in the region. 
It would be a plus if you have (basic) knowledge of SAP
Knowledge of server hardware or components (hard drives, memory) is a plus.



Who are you? 

We‚Äôre‚ÄØlooking for a team player with logistics/inventory, with a passion for IT. You should be a highly dependable and responsible individual. 

About‚ÄØLeaseweb 

Leaseweb‚ÄØis a leading cloud hosting provider that offers a broad range of products and services including, private cloud, dedicated servers, hybrid hosting, colocation, CDN, and cybersecurity. Working with companies ranging from SMBs to enterprises,‚ÄØLeaseweb‚ÄØhas the flexibility, market knowledge, and technical expertise to provide the perfect balance of price and performance. The‚ÄØLeaseweb‚ÄØplatform resides on one of the largest, most reliable networks in the world, boasting 5.5‚ÄØTbps‚ÄØbandwidth capacity and 99.999% core uptime, low latency, and fast response time from 25 data‚ÄØcenters‚ÄØthroughout the world. 

What We Offer


Competitive salary + AWS + annual bonus scheme
The possibility to develop yourself and build your career
Comprehensive Health Insurance
18 days of paid time off
A great working environment in a dynamic, international, fast-growing organization



Ready for the next step?

If you‚Äôd like to apply, please do so online. To learn more about us, follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram to get an inside look at the life at Leaseweb.

 Recruitment agency? Thank you for your interest, but we are sourcing all our candidates directly. We appreciate you trying anyway but please keep in mind that any unsolicited profiles you send us will be treated as direct applications.

Title: Head of Property & Expansion, APAC
Description Snippet:
About the job

Are you ready to be part of our team in Singapore who are busy growing our franchise business in Asia?




Then we are looking for a vital colleague in the role as Head of Property & Expansion, APAC to ensure we will succeed in our ambitious growth strategy.

- maybe you have the profile we are looking for!




Stepping into the role as Head of Property & Expansion, APAC your primary responsibility is to drive the expansion of the brand in the region whilst ensuring high standards of property selection and delivery are adhered to by our existing and new franchisee partners. You will identify new partners and keep the business appraised on expansion plans, targets, and opportunities, updating the GPD on all relevant matters. This is a role that will require market visits and therefore you must expect business trips to be part of your job. Our current franchise markets in the region are Korea, Japan, Indonesia, and the Philippines.




You will work from Flying Tiger Copenhagen‚Äôs office in Singapore (Robinson Rd), and you will work closely with our Property & Expansion team in Copenhagen.




Your responsibilities will be




Identify new franchisees and potential markets.
Supervise all aspects of the property portfolio and support the franchisees where required.
Help manage the site appraisal and approval processes for new locations, relocations, and closures.
Keep accurate and up-to-date records and reports, inputting data into global databases where required.
Work cross-functionally to effectively help franchisees resolve property issues or disputes.
Assist in planning annual budgets by forecasting expansion data and trends in the market.
Review franchisee performance against their expansion plan targets and report on the same.
Lead the development of new ways of working to improve our service to the franchisees in this area.
Assist colleagues in the wider global property and expansion team, ensuring the regional franchisees supply all the relevant information as and when required.




This is you

We imagine that you have min. 7 years of relevant experience working within retail franchising with a property bias. Ideally, you have great experience working across different markets in Asia and therefore hold strong relationships within the retail real estate market and among landlords.

The ability to analyze and interrogate business cases, overhead cost models, and margin reports effectively and accurately is key to success in the role. You have a history of assisting and working with legal and operational teams in new markets and a proven track record in large multi-territory portfolio supervision.

In short - you know how to deliver market expansion via a franchise model within a successful overall implementation strategy.




As we are an international team and our stakeholders are from all over the world, we expect you to speak and write fluently in English (Cantonese or Mandarin is an advantage). Furthermore, we know that you are an expert in Microsoft Office applications, such as Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.




This is us

We are growing the team in Singapore as we are expanding the business, we are currently present with 6 dedicated colleagues in our Singapore office, and we are growing. Our target is to open 1.000 Franchise stores in 5 years. We are busy but we insist on having fun while we work. We are entrepreneurs and not afraid to test new ways of working or thinking out of the box.

We are +300 People working from Flying Tiger Copenhagen¬¥s headquarters in Copenhagen.

Flying Tiger Copenhagen is a company with strong values founded in Scandinavian culture. We want to be fun and relevant, and we put our heart into everything we do. If this resonates with you, hurry up and apply ‚Äì we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you.




You can read much more about our company, values, ambitions, and numbers here: https://flyingtiger.com/da-dk/pages/corporate




Did you know

We take climate change very seriously and work very hard to minimize our carbon footprint. We do this by buying less plastic and more renewable materials (everything that grows) ‚Äì and we also want to make sure that all stores are run on renewable energy. We walk the talk ‚Äì and make sure that what we do is validated by external experts, in the Science Based Targets initiative. You can read more about our work with climate action here https://flyingtiger.com/pages/sustainability-eco-friendly

Hudson River Trading (HRT) is seeking an ETF Pricing Engineering Specialist to join our high-impact team working on the firm's growing ETF efforts. In this role, you'll collaborate with global trading teams, interface with automated trading systems across asset classes and regions, and contribute to ETF market strategies.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about financial markets, coding, tackling challenges, and making an immediate, tangible impact at HRT.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. Title: Risk Officer
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Title:

Risk Officer

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

Risk Officer, Singapore

Summary Of Company

Gunvor Group is one of the world‚Äôs largest independent commodities trading houses by turnover, creating logistics solutions that safely and efficiently move physical energy from where it is sourced and stored to where it is demanded most. With strategic investments in industrial infrastructure‚Äîrefineries, pipelines, storage, and terminals‚ÄîGunvor further generates sustainable value across the global supply chain for its customers. Gunvor, founded in 2000, generated US $135 billion in revenues on volumes of 240 million MT in 2021. The company remains on track to meet its goal of cutting Scope 1 and 2 emissions 40% by 2025.

Gunvor has more than 1,500 employees and it maintains offices in Singapore, Amsterdam, Beijing, Dubai, Geneva, Houston, London, Shanghai, and Tallinn with new offices planned in strategically relevant markets.

Overview Of Role

The Risk Officer is part of the Risk team based in Singapore reporting to the Regional Head of Risk Office, APAC and will work in close collaboration with traders, operations, trade support, accounting and back office. This role is a key control function ensuring quality reporting of trading performance and risk analysis for the region.

Main Responsibilities


Daily trading P&L validation and reporting to traders and management. This includes analysis of the key drivers of P&L and reconciliation against trader's estimates and market fundamentals
Daily exposure reconciliation with traders
Liaise and coordinate daily with operations for logistical impact on risk exposure and P&L/costs
Daily reconciliation of listed derivative contracts between exchange statements and in-house ETRM systems
Daily validation of trade economics of physical trades done against trade recaps
Ensure curves are reasonably marked by comparing against broker quotes/reliable external sources
Check marked to market curves applied to physical deal valuation daily
Allocate hedges in strategies, as the case may be
Monitor daily VAR consumption against VAR limits and report breaches to Head of Risk, Asia Pacific on a timely basis.
Responsible for reviewing, investigation and resolution of month end breaks between in-house ETRM system trading results and accounting.
Responsible for setting up new curves/calendar set up and onboarding new products to be traded in-house ETRM system for risk management and P&L generation
Will be expected to participate and contribute to any system and process migration projects relating to Risk function
Perform cross coverage within Risk team
Identify and implement ways to streamline existing processes such as automation
Provide risk analytics for management reporting
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by manager



Profile

The individual should have the following:


Minimum Bachelor's degree with a major in, Accountancy, Business Administration, Business Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics. Polytechnic or diploma holder qualifications with relevant experience will be considered.
Minimum 2 or more years‚Äô work experience in the trading/commodities houses as Risk Officer (or equivalent) for both derivatives and physical trades.
Fluent in spoken and written English and Chinese
Strong Excel is a must.
Strong preference for Excel VBA, Python or Power Query/BI skills.



Other Attributes/Pre-requisites


Self-motivated and able to work independently and yet a team player
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong control mindset
Numerate, meticulous, rigorous, proactive, analytical and resilient
Ability to work under pressure in dynamic environment
Ability to work late hours and some SG public holidays when necessary



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Cyber Threat Analyst
Description Snippet:
About the job
Summary Of The Role

The Cyber Threat Analyst is an experienced threat detection and response analyst within Marina Bay Sands‚Äô (MBS) Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC). MBS CSOC operates a follow-the-sun model, partnering with Las Vegas Sands (LVS) Corp CSOC. The mission of MBS CSOC is to protect and defend MBS and LVS against cyber-attacks targeting the integrated resort, retail and hospitality sector.

The Cyber Threat Analyst coordinates daily monitoring of cyber threat detection and mitigation tools, reviews Cyber Threat Analysts activities, tune and apply defensive counter-measures to mitigate cyber threats. This position works closely with the global CSOC team members in other centers around the world.

All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Marina Bay Sands‚Äô policies, practices, and procedures.

 Key Performance Objectives 


Review and supervise performance of cyber threat analysts in detecting and responding to cyber threats.
Apply defensive countermeasures to mitigate potential cyber threats timely.
Perform initial response / containment measure where required.
Ensure potential cyber threats from external cyber threat information sources are identified and escalated timely.


 JOB SCOPE 


Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job
Ensure cyber threats are mitigated and escalated in a timely fashion.
Ensure cyber threat detection tools are tuned and maintained timely.
Ensure CSOC analyst runbooks are reviewed timely.
Review CSOC metrics and trending, including the health of the security monitoring systems.
Ensure IT compliance within CSOC operations.
Ensure CSOC compliance with regulatory requirement.
Ensure cases are followed-up by Cyber Threat Analysts timely.
Participate in the investigation of security violations and breaches.
Maintain an understanding of the current vulnerabilities, response, and mitigation strategies used to support cyber security operations
Performs other related duties as assigned
Perform weekend day-shift on rotation basis.


Job Requirements 


Degree or diploma with at least 3-5 years of work experience in detecting and responding to cyber threats, preferably in a Global CSOC environment. Fresh Graduates or candidates with IT Security experience will be considered for Analyst I positions.
Professional cyber-related membership and certification is required.
Experience in Integrated Resort, Banking or Critical Infrastructure InfoComm Industry is preferred, but not a must.
Proven effective verbal and written communication skills.
Abilities required:
Apply techniques for detecting host and network-based intrusions using intrusion detection technologies.
Communicate complex information, concepts, or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal, written, and/or visual means.
Knowledge required:
Computer networking concepts and protocols.
Cyber threats and vulnerabilities
Incident categories, responses and timelines.
System and application security threats and vulnerabilities.
Security service provider reporting structure and processes.
Defence-in-depth principles and network security architecture.
Common attack vectors.
Cyber-attack stages.
Skills required:
Detect host and network based intrusions.
Collect data from a variety of cyber defence resources.
Recognize and categorize types of vulnerabilities and associated attacks.
Protect a network against malware.
Read and interpret detection signatures.

 Work Environment 


Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and global working environment.
Adapt and adjust to priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established time frames
Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow Team Members, management, outside contacts, guests and the public.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Title: Casualty Underwriter

About the job

The Job: 

You will conduct day to day underwriting and related administrative tasks as part of the Singapore Casualty Middle Market & Small Commercial Division (SMD) team. Extensive experience and knowledge across Casualty Lines products

Title: Fuels Sales & Operations Planning Scheduler
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society‚Äôs evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together .

ExxonMobil in Singapore

ExxonMobil is one of Singapore‚Äôs largest foreign manufacturing investors with over S$25 billion in fixed asset investments.

We have manufacturing facilities that include an integrated world-scale refining and petrochemical complex in Jurong and Jurong Island, a network of service stations under the Esso brand, operate a lubricant plant and are a supplier of cylinder cooking gas. ExxonMobil provides customers and commercial markets in the region with ground transportation, industrial, aviation and marine fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and liquefied natural gas (LNG).

As Singapore serves as the AP hub for some of our businesses, we employ about 3,500 people across positions in operations, projects, commercial, corporate support functions and others.

ExxonMobil also contributes to community programs in Singapore that support the arts, education, health and the environment.

For more information, visit www.exxonmobil.com.sg or follow ExxonMobil Singapore on LinkedIn and Instagram.

What You Will Do


 Collaborate with a team to coordinate oil product movements and manage fuels product supply reliability to ExxonMobil refineries, chemical plants, affiliates, terminals and customers 
 Coordinate loading and discharge orders, blending optimization, surveyor nominations and documentation instructions 
 Work with the respective departments to vet vessels and for payments and security clearance

 Participate in projects, business initiatives, business reviews and support process enhancements 
 Utilize data analytics to gain market insights and identify marine or logistics improvement opportunities 
 Manage transactional systems to ensure shipment data is updated in a timely manner for invoicing and payment 
 Support inventory management, product blending, freight optimization, product quality management and supply chain issue resolution 



About You

Skills and Qualifications


 A degree from a recognized university with minimum three years of work experience in oil cargo operations 
 A degree in Chemical Engineering will be an advantage 
 Prior work experience in blending operations will be an advantage 
 Meticulous, with the ability to work in a multicultural, fast-paced environment 
 Excellent interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills 



Your Benefits

An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last and we provide job rotations throughout your career with us. Our commitment to you runs deep: our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance, and life.

Currently our employees benefits include: Long Term Savings Allowance, dental reimbursement, annual health checkups and Home Ownership Assistance Plan amongst others and these are updated from time to time.

Stay connected with us:


 Learn more at our website 
 Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram 
 Like us on Facebook 
 Subscribe our channel at YouTube 



Equal Opportunity Employer

The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

Please be informed that only shortlisted candidates will be notified, and you can find out more about our hiring process here .

We thank you for your interest in ExxonMobil.

Nothing herein is intended to override the corporate separateness of local entities. Working relationships discussed herein do not necessarily represent a reporting connection, but may reflect a functional guidance, stewardship, or service relationship.

Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. For convenience and simplicity, those terms and terms like corporation, company, our, we and its are sometimes used as abbreviated references to specific affiliates or affiliate groups. Abbreviated references describing global or regional operational organizations and global or regional business lines are also sometimes used for convenience and simplicity. Similarly, ExxonMobil has business relationships with thousands of customers, suppliers, governments, and others. For convenience and simplicity, words like venture, joint venture, partnership, co-venturer, and partner are used to indicate business relationships involving common activities and interests, and those words may not indicate precise legal relationships.

Title: Managing Principal - Wealth & Asset Management
Description Snippet:
About the job

MANAGING PRINCIPAL ‚Äì WEALTH & ASSET MANAGEMENT




Singapore




ABOUT CAPCO




Capco, a Wipro company, is a global technology and management consultancy specializing in driving digital transformation in the financial services industry. With a growing client portfolio comprising of over 100 global organizations, Capco operates at the intersection of business and technology by combining innovative thinking with unrivalled industry knowledge to deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions and fast-track digital initiatives for banking and payments, capital markets, wealth and asset management, insurance, and the energy sector. Capco‚Äôs cutting-edge ingenuity is brought to life through its Innovation Labs and award-winning be Yourself At Work culture and diverse talent.




We are/have:




We are experts in Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth and Asset Management.
We are rapidly expanding our Insurance sector capability.
We specialise in Digital Transformation, Data Management & Data Analytics, Business & Finance Transformation engagements, and IT transformation and Change programmes.
We are committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent in the market.
Our focus is on maintaining our agile and entrepreneurial culture.




RESPONSIBILITIES




As a Managing Principal at Capco, you will be playing a key role in the delivery of projects, working on client sites to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading Local and MNCs across the Wealth & Asset sector.




Key for this role is there is requirement to have a background in Wealth & Asset Management and/or Financial Services within one of our core capability areas:




Digital Transformation
Data Strategy, Data Management & Data Analytics
Business & Finance Transformation
IT Transformation




We are keen to bring on those from a consulting background in BFSI industries that can apply their perspectives and techniques to our core sectors and capability.




We are looking for exceptional talent with the following:




Strong interpersonal and influencing skills; the ability to interact with colleagues at all levels and achieve goals without direct control over resources.
Having a strong commercial focus, the ability to develop client relationships, and lead sales opportunities and domain propositions.
Ability build market networks and relationships within the Wealth & Asset space.
SME knowledge in Wealth & Asset Management.
Engaging with technical and non-technical audiences to deliver change initiatives for leading clients across financial services, including investment banking, retail banking, wealth, and capital markets.
Strong emerging end-to-end generalist problem solving skills, e.g., defining, and deconstructing problems.
Extensive project and people management experience and ability to deliver and manage projects and individuals workstreams.




SKILLS AND EXPERTISE




Diverse problem-solving experience, such as experience with a top management consulting firm or in other generalist problem solving environments across the Wealth & Asset sector.
An outstanding ability to think strategically, execute tactically, and enable cross-business and cross-functional teams.
Experience and capabilities to communicate with client leaders to influence direction and manage expectations, and excellent project and people management skills.
Strong understanding of Agile ways of working would be an advantage.




WHY CAPCO? 




We are expanding our business rapidly across Singapore and Asia. You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banking and insurance clients in the world, projects that will deliver significant transformation and change.




We offer:




You will join a company that supports and encourages an entrepreneurial outlook and independent thinking. Capco is not about organizational charts and layers ‚Äì we operate with little hierarchy because we want all employees to feel that Capco is their firm. We warmly value diversity and inclusion and embrace our collective uniqueness ‚Äì our culture is a strong, fresh, and invigorating difference from our competitors.

 

We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical and dental insurance and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.

Title: AVP/VP Securitisation
Description Snippet:
About the job
You will have demonstrated academic achievement in finance. You must have good attention to detail and numerical skills, and an ability to work with and interpret large volumes of data. You have good writing skills to prepare thorough analysis and internal reports. An understanding of securitisation and financial markets and prior exposure to securitisation or credit analytics is required, and exposure to legal documentation for bond issuance is preferred. You are a proactive individual who has a willingness to learn attitude and an analytical mind-set, and is able to quickly step up to take new responsibilities.

Responsibilities


 Conduct analysis, make recommendations, and present analysis and recommendations to internal credit teams
 Analyse data, and be proficient in evaluating data and reaching conclusions, getting periodic updates from clients on portfolios.
 Build, review and run cash flow, ABS and CLO models for securitisations across various asset classes including ABS, RMBS, Trade receivables securitisation and Private Credit
 Analyse and review transaction documentation with legal counsel.
 Support the origination, structuring and execution of warehousing and other structured asset finance transactions in East Asia and Asia Oceania.



Requirements


 Relevant securitisation/structured credit experience in Banking and/or rating agencies.
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills
 3-15 years of analytical work experience in the financial services industry
 Experience in managing and interpreting data for analytical purposes
 Solid analytical capability, able to form and present conclusions and recommendations.
 Team player and has good time management skills
 Proactive and good problem solving skills
 Able to multi-task and meet projects with a tight time frame
 Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-changing, global and regulated environment
 Strong verbal and written communication skills

Title: AVP, Digital HR Strategy 15445
Description Snippet:
About the job
GIC is one of the world‚Äôs largest sovereign wealth funds. With over 2,000 employees across 11 locations around the world, we invest in more than 40 countries globally across asset classes and businesses. Working at GIC gives you exposure to an extraordinary network of the world‚Äôs industry leaders. As a leading global long-term investor, we Work at the Point of Impact for Singapore‚Äôs financial future, and the communities we invest in worldwide.

Human Resource & Organization Department

We drive GIC‚Äôs talent strategies, and shape the organisational culture to sustain GIC‚Äôs long-term performance.

People Analytics & Solutions

You will drive employee experience, operational efficiency, and robust downstream data, through designing and implementation strong digital processes.

What impact can you make in this role?

You will be part of a team that champions the people agenda for GIC.

What will you do as a Digital HR practitioner?

This is a valuable opportunity for a passionate Digital HR practitioner to join a hybrid People Analytics and (Digital) Solutions team. The team‚Äôs twofold mandate includes driving People Analytics & the Digital HR agenda at GIC. What success looks like for this role ‚Äì creating greater operational efficiency and business impact through accurate resource planning and simulation.

60% responsibility ‚Äì Internal Planning consultant


Build, enhance and trouble-shoot, planning models for compensation planning, workforce planning, and other resource planning, using Anaplan or other planning platform. 
Act as a business analyst to clearly understand project objectives and problem statements directly from business users. Identify and implement practical solutions to constraints (e.g., process or data related constraints etc) in the model design and build. 
Bring a product owner mindset and be an end-to-end owner of such planning and simulation models ‚Äì ensure the model is fit for purpose, e.g. easy to use, incorporates the right variables and assumptions, and has the right sensitivity to changes in underlying variables. 
Play the role of a communicator to Technology teams to get their support on platform management, platform security etc. 
Understand different HR systems and processes, to design how best they should interact with the planning platform. 
Act as a project manager to manage the design, test, and roll out of new models/ model enhancements. 



40% responsibility ‚Äì Internal People Analytics consultant


Analyze and interpret large data sets, with a focus on producing actionable insight for people development. 
Design intuitive, self-service dashboards on Tableau to generate insights that drive action for HR, larger business leaders and senior management. 
Effectively story-tell with data to non-technical audiences. 



What qualifications or skills should you possess in this role? 


Degree in Statistics, Computing, Design or Technology. 
At least 2 years of relevant experience in building planning and simulation models, on Anaplan or similar planning tools, in HR, Finance or other domains. 
Strong working experience with tools like SQL, Python, R etc in data manipulation. 
Experience in creating solutions with the right user-experience. 
Effective team player who is independent, keen to learn, and with strong analytical, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. 
Resourceful, adaptable and resilient to evolving changes and challenges. 
Displays leadership and influence, as an individual contributor to drive delivery with partners. 
Candidates with the following skills/experience have an edge:
Prior working experience on Anaplan
Process Design, process re-engineering or digital design experience in any field 



Work at the Point of Impact

We need to be forward-looking to attract the right people to help us become the Leading Global Long-term Investor. Join our ambitious, agile, and diverse teams - be empowered to push boundaries and pursue innovative ideas, share your views, and be heard. Be anchored on our PRIME Values: Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence, which guides us in how we make our day-to-day decisions. We strive to inspire. To make an impact.

Flexibility at GIC

At GIC, our offices are vibrant hubs for ideation, professional growth, and interpersonal connection. At the same time, we believe that flexibility allows us to do our best work and be our best selves. Thus, our teams come into the office four days per week to harness the benefits of in-person collaboration, but have the flexibility to choose which days they work from home and adjust this arrangement as situational needs arise.

GIC is an equal opportunity employer 

GIC is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Please email grphrodtaops@gic.com.sg at any point of the application or interview process if adjustments need to be made due to a disability.

Learn More

Learn more about our Human Resource & Organization Department here: https://gic.careers/group/human-resource-organization/
Our PRIME Values
GIC is a values driven organization. GIC‚Äôs PRIME Values act as our compass, enabling us to fulfil our fundamental purpose and objectives. It is the foundational bedrock which governs our behaviors, our decision making, and our focus. It informs both our long-term strategy as a firm, and the way we relate to our Client, business partners and employees. PRIME stands for Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence.

Title: Technology Scout (SMEs Go Digital)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

What The Role Is

As part of the Sectoral Transformation Group in IMDA, the SMEs Go Digital Division aims to make going digital simple for SMEs. With digital technology transforming every sector of Singapore‚Äôs economy, it is essential that our SMEs have the digital technologies and capabilities to seize growth opportunities in the digital economy.

In support of this effort, the SMEs Go Digital Division develops Industry Digital Plans (IDP) as a roadmap to guide SME's digital adoption and capability development, as well as supports technology adoption by SMEs through the curation and pre-approval of suitable digital solutions.

What You Will Be Working On

Support the creation and update of assigned sectors‚Äô Industry Digital Plans:


Perform market scan for specific sectors, technical reviews, and technology assessment with domain leads/experts including but not limited to Cyber Security, Internet of Things, Robotics Process Automation, Blockchain, Personal Data Security, Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud
Study how latest digital technology trends can impact the sectors, identify potential risk/issues, and analyse SMEs‚Äô adoption and utilisation data to identify opportunities for redesigning processes to maximise business outcomes at both enterprise and industry levels
Creating a library of industry and technology knowledge for the SMEs Go Digital division, including the consolidation and creation of artefacts to documents the technology landscape, key players and segments, demos, tech specifications, experiments and results, key contacts, and assessment of technologies and solutions
Simplify information and technical jargons so it is easily understood by internal stakeholders and SMEs



Architecting and curating industry-specific solutions that could be widely adopted by Singapore SMEs in the near term


Define and launch call-for-proposals to support the transformation and development of new solutions of assigned sectors
Provides additional technological support to the Solution Curation team to identify and determine the qualification, and qualify, of ready-to-use solutions for SMEs
Coordinate with and leverage other technology research and development teams within IMDA to define specific implementations of the latest technologies for the assigned sectors



What We Are Looking For


Background in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business IT or equivalent.
At least 5 years of experience with solution architecture, pre-sales, or technology research on projects involving digital technologies
Strong working knowledge in ICT (added advantage if you have one or more technical knowledge domain in Cyber Security, Internet of Things, Robotics Process Automation, Blockchain, Personal Data Security, Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Technology etc.)
Strong communication and stakeholder management to bring across clarity in technical solutions for various audiences
Domain knowledge of one or more key industries is a plus: manufacturing, land/air/sea transport, construction, environment services, security, early childhood, healthcare, financial services, legal, retail, food services/manufacturing, logistics, media etc.

Title: Network Security Operations - GSO (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job

About Us

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 




Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 

Join us.




The Global Security Organization ensures ByteDance's worldwide security and privacy with four guiding principles: trust and transparency, innovation catalyst, informed decision-making, and proactive risk reduction. Reporting to the Network Security Lead, you'll join the Security Operations team responsible for various security functions. Your role as a Network Security Operations specialist involves supporting the deployment and management of technologies to safeguard data, comply with regulations, and enhance security. You'll work with a team to monitor our global infrastructure, improve technology platforms, and design security controls. This contributes to creating a secure environment for TikTok's infrastructure, technologies, and services.




Tasks and Responsibilities:

- Support the formulation and execution of enterprise-wide network security initiatives

- Establish technical and functional prerequisites for configuring and deploying network security tools

- Architect and continually enhance the security technology stack, processes, procedures, support structure, and cross-functional interactions

- Create standard operating procedures and training materials for each technology

- Evaluate and appraise the utilization of network security toolsets, Champion and promote the adoption of network security tools across the entire organization

- Develop and present metrics outlining network security coverage and remediation plans

- Cultivate and maintain robust vendor relationships for ongoing support of network security tools

- Establish protocols to validate the effectiveness of security controls' design, deployment, and management, ensuring the preservation of network and technology platform confidentiality, integrity, and availability

- Implement and oversee global network security infrastructure, encompassing Firewalls, DDoS mitigation, VPN, IPS/IDS Systems, Egress Filtering, Edge Security, Cryptography, and Web Application Security




Qualifications

Knowledge and Skills:

- Thrives under pressure while adhering to time and budget constraints, adept at swiftly adapting to changing priorities and making informed decisions in uncertain situations

- Skilled at navigating risks in complex and ambiguous scenarios and have a proven ability to collaborate effectively within a team

- Highly motivated to make meaningful contributions and advance in a rapidly evolving field of significance

- Capable of conveying technical concepts to both technical and non-technical individuals

- Solid comprehension of:

 - Analyzing numeric data and applying statistical principles

 - Proficiency in operating and maintaining tools within the Network Security Technology stack




Minimum Qualifications:

- A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in cybersecurity, security architecture, or related fields within a converged security program. Possess a minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience.

- Demonstrate the capability to rapidly acquire new knowledge and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in cybersecurity and industry trends.

- Exhibit a high level of integrity and trustworthiness, along with the ability to lead and inspire change.

- Proficiency in utilizing network diagnosis and packet analysis tools and strong knowledge of routing and switching technologies, including TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and others.

- A passion for delivering exceptional customer service, coupled with a keen attention to detail and precision.

- In-depth expertise in the following areas:

 - Network Detection and Response.

 - Microservice architecture.

 - Web Application Firewalls.

 - Perimeter Security.

 - Configuration of network and host-based firewalls.




Preferred Qualifications:

- CISSP, SSCP, CAP, CCSP, CISM, CSX-P or applicable experience in the Information Security field

- CCNA/CCNP, PCNSE, AWS Networking, Security, and related Cloud Networking/Security certifications are a plus.

- Experience using one or more programming/scripting languages (e.g., Python, Go, Java, etc.)

- Familiarity with source code management tools (e.g., Github, Bitbucket)

- Familiarity with securing data across SaaS and IaaS cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud Platform)

- Familiarity with securing data across multiple database technologies (e.g., MySQL, Redis, Hive)

- Be able to handle ambiguity and collaborate with a global team

- Be comfortable communicating with business executives and technical teams




TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Posted on Feb 22, 2024.

Title: Global Payment Fraud Expert
Description Snippet:
About the job
Who Are We?

At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.

Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.

HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.

When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy. This policy provides detailed insights into how your information is collected, used, and protected throughout the application process.

What You Will Do:

You'll be in the Globalization team helping to build the best Fraud prevention strategy, participate in different game projects and business activities in various countries to protect HoYoverse's growth and prevent the company's losses revenues. We are looking for an experienced fraud professional with a strong understanding of online fraud, the incentives of fraudsters, a data mindset, and a love for fast-paced environments.

Responsibilities:


Participate in the payment prevention missions, responsible for daily contact with PSP / supplier channels, crack down on payment risk cases, anti-interregional purchase, and financial/legal/platform processes, to ensure project management, coordination, and communication between internal and external teams.
Use various effective methods and strategies to monitor, detect, and identify cases of stolen cards and fraudulent behavior.
Create patent tags of players' payment behaviors, including various dynamic and static features, timing behaviors, risk network, and geographic location identification tags, etc.
You are familiar with the whole risk process in digital business scenarios of three-party payment, formulate and optimize payment risk strategies for different business links.
Assist in establishing the early warning monitoring system based on business data, risk parameters, and strategies.
Responsible for the deployment of payment business risk rules or models, and follow-up on the daily work of payment risk control strategies.


What We Are Looking For:


Bachelor's degree and significant (relevant) experience in card-acquiring sectors.
Proficiency in using SQL/Hive/Spark and other data statistics tools.
Mastery of common languages such as Python/R is a plus.
Great sense of responsibility, as well as strong learning, time management, and executive skill.
In-depth understanding of online payment business, industry regulation, trends, and strong data processing and analysis capabilities are preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both English and Chinese.


We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

Title: Crewing Officer
Description Snippet:
About the job

Are you looking for a career in the marine services industry? Look no further than Smit Lamnalco! We are a leading provider of safe, reliable, and customized marine services to Oil, Gas and LNG terminals, as well as Port operations.



Our diverse fleet of approximately 160 modern vessels and over 2500 skilled crew and staff members serve customers worldwide. We specialize in providing marine support services tailored to the unique operational needs of our global customers in local markets.



At Smit Lamnalco, we're committed to maintaining international standards on safety and reliability to onshore and offshore operations in challenging environments. Our headquarters are located in Rotterdam, the Netherlands.



If you're interested in joining our team, we encourage you to visit our website atwww.smitlamnalco.comto learn more about our company and available job opportunities. Thank you for considering Smit Lamnalco as your potential employer in the marine services industry!



Job Description



Currently we have a job opening for a:



Crewing Officer (Singapore)



Smit Lamnalco Crew Mgt. manages and employs around 1400 Seafarers across operations in various ports around the globe. This Position has shared responsibility for Africa operations and reports directly to the Group Crewing & HR Manager.



Responsibilities:

Verify documents, medical fitness and check references of new recruits to ensure compliance with STCW & SLIMS standards.
Ensure the timely and complete provision of employment documents and information to crew.
Arrange appointments for Crew inductions, simulator assessments and Marlin tests.
Arrange and manage crew travel (mob- and demob) and all necessary administration and documents for on and off signing crew.

Ensure the training and development of all crew is planned according to schedule.
Monitor and follow up with the Contract Managers on outstanding appraisal forms.


Qualifications



To be successful in the role:

You must already be working and living in Singapore.
Experience with crewing.


Additional Information



Applications can be submitted via our website to the attention of Ben Wray (Group Crewing & HR Manager).



Employment conditions:



Smit Lamnalco offers a competitive Compensation & Benefit package. We offer you the opportunity to develop yourself in a challenging, dynamic and truly international environment. Interested in spending a couple of years abroad? We offer this possibility frequently.

Smit Lamnalco is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

Title: Permanent Control Coordinator
Description Snippet:
About the job
Position Purpose

Within the Asia Pacific CIB IT & Operations organization, the Regional OPC (Operational Permanent Control) team for Corporate Banking Operations is under the management of the Head of Conduct & Controls and works in close relationship with the Operations teams.

Regional Corporate Banking OPC team is looking to recruit a Senior Permanent Control Coordinator. His/her main responsibilities is to implement the operational risk management framework and monitor the operational risk related to Corporate Banking Operations across all 12 Territories in APAC. Hence, he/she will analyse control results (Ops, OPC, LoD2, LoD3) and incidents to identify main operational risks and follow the associated mitigation/remediation actions (including recommendations).

Responsibilities

Direct Responsibilities

The Permanent Control Coordinator ensures the following missions under the supervision of the Regional Head of Operations & Permanent Control (OPC) for Corporate Banking and in close relationship with Operations teams.

Implementation of Operational Risk Management


Coordinate and perform the Risk and Control Self-Assessment with Operations Managers and Senior Management
Define and execute the control testing, present the controls result to Senior Management and ensure the implementation of remediation actions
Provide support with the harmonization of the execution of C5 controls across all 12 Territories in APAC
Support the Operation teams in the implementation and deployment of C1-C4 controls
Follow up and review findings and recommendations issued by internal auditors, regulators, and external auditors
Ensure operational risk incidents are properly collected, coordinate the root cause analysis and contribute to the definition of remedial actions
Perform Deep Dive analysis/ thematic review on specific processes based on identified risk areas 
Monitor regulations and internal policy changes to ensure implementation by Operations Team.



Operational Risk Governance


Organize and contribute to Team meetings and APAC CBO PCC to ensure proper escalation of operational risk issues.
Coordinate and prepare the contribution to various committees (e.g.: APAC Operational Risk Management Framework, APAC Internal Control Committees, APAC CCCO, TBA ITO Committee, ..)
Support Territory OPCs in performing the respective mandates and consolidate the results for management reporting.
Assist the team manager in transversal tasks like deep dives, trainings, dashboards productions and be pro-active in suggesting improvements in the team‚Äôs daily work



Technical And Behavioral Competencies Required

Essential Technical Knowledge/Skills:


Corporate Banking experience, ideally in Payment & Cash / Trade Operations
Knowledge of BNPP Corporate Banking Operation set-up used in APAC (e.g.: products, internal systems, ..)
Knowledge of Bank‚Äôs Internal Control systems: ORUS and RISK360



Qualifications and Experience:


Degree or Equivalent (> 4 years)
Minimum 8 years of experience in Internal Control, Operational Risk, Internal or External Audit function 



Other Value-Added Competencies:


Attention to detail
Ability to manage several initiatives/projects and keep these on-track simultaneously
Ability to effectively manage your own time and the priorities 
Interpersonal skills, ability to consolidate action plans and report progress status
Pragmatic, ‚ÄòCan do‚Äô attitude & Proactive approach with a strong ability to work on own initiative 
Capable of adapting to a new environment and to work under pressure towards tight deadlines
Excellent oral and written communication
Good interpersonal skills 
Big picture awareness



About BNP PARIBAS

As the leading European Union bank, and one of the world‚Äôs largest financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence in the region since 1860, BNP Paribas offers a wide range of financial services for corporate, institutional and private investors spanning corporate and institutional banking, wealth management, asset management and insurance.

Title: Risk Consulting, Cyber, Graduate Associate 2024
Description Snippet:
About the job

As part of the KPMG Cyber team, you will be working with experienced cyber security professionals and corporate partners under the 5 pillars of our Cyber business:




Cyber Strategy and Governance professionals provide advice to CEOs, CISOs and CIOs on how to better manage cyber security by designing their Cyber Organisational Structure, and defining the Cyber Security Strategy to combine people, processes and technology tools. You will work on topics as diverse as Cyber Strategy, Technology Risk Management, Data Governance, Privacy, Business Continuity & Crisis Management and regulatory compliance. You will help clients identify and assess risks, design strategy & policies and roll-out new processes.




Cyber Defence covers vulnerability assessment, application and network penetration testing, wireless security, mobile security, and system security testing to identify blind spots and provide in-depth assessments of overlooked weaknesses. As an Ethical Hacker/Penetration Tester, you will use cutting-edge techniques to pre-emptively test and defeat cyber security defences with the ultimate purpose of helping our clients re-design defences to better withstand an actual cyber-attack.




Cyber Transformation professionals work with clients to automate Cyber business processes by deploying Technology solutions. We customise tech solutions to client‚Äôs specific needs to achieve business outcomes efficiently and solve business problems using technology. As Cyber Transformation professionals, you will design tech enabled processes, deploy tech solutions and enable people to use technology to achieve Cyber Security.




Cyber Response professionals work at the forefront of major cyber-attacks, supporting clients as the ‚ÄúFirst Responders‚Äù to any major cyber emergency. Cyber Response helps clients who experience a cyber security incident such as ransomware, business e-mail compromise or other network intrusions. We investigate the root cause and extent of the breach and help clients to recover from the incident ‚Äì restore systems and expel intruders and provide practical recommendations on how to prevent further incidents.




Cyber Education offers comprehensive cyber security training to equip clients and organisations with the skills and know-how to manage cyber threats.

 

The ideal candidate should:

Enthusiastic with a keen interest in the field of cyber security
Client-focused with good communication skills
Work as part of a team and independently
Driven to learn and share knowledge with clients and colleagues
Work experience such as internships, leadership positions in clubs/associations, or part-time jobs will be considered positively

 

If you are looking to join our Cyber Strategy & Governance service line, you will need to demonstrate the following capabilities:

A process mindset ‚Äì to construct and de-construct processes to understand how things work
Ability to understand both business and IT challenges, which will help in designing strategy, policies and processes
A degree in IT, Engineering, or a Business field would be advantageous

 

If you are looking to join our Cyber Defence, Cyber Response or Cyber Transformation service line you will need to demonstrate the following capabilities:

Basic programming proficiency ‚Äì able to write scripts in any common scripting language ‚Äì make web requests, look up data in a database, able to use regular expressions.
Ability to program in any common language and troubleshoot programs
Good understanding of Microsoft Windows and Linux OS
Computer troubleshooting skills

‚†Ä

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: Associate, Producer

About the job
About The Company

Gemini is a global crypto and Web3 platform founded by Tyler Winklevoss and Cameron Winklevoss in 2014. Gemini offers a wide range of crypto products and services for individuals and institutions in over 70 countries.

Crypto is about giving you greater choice, independence, and opportunity. We are here to help you on your journey. We build crypto products that are simple, elegant, and secure. Whether you are an individual or an institution, we help you buy, sell, and store your bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

At Gemini, our mission is to unlock the next era of financial, creative, and personal freedom.

In Singapore, we have a hybrid work policy. Employees are expected to work from the office part of the week. We believe our hybrid approach increases productivity through more in-person collaboration where possible.

The Department: Nifty Gateway (Growth)

Nifty Gateway is the premiere, all-in-one platform that makes it easy to buy, sell, and store digital art and collectibles, otherwise known as Nifties (or NFTs). Nifty Gateway was founded by Duncan and Griffin Cock Foster in 2018, and acquired by Gemini in 2019, with the belief that crypto networks and the blockchain have the power to fundamentally change the art world by creating greater choice, independence, and opportunity for artists, creators, and collectors.

The Role: Associate, Producer

We are looking for an Associate Producer to grow our creative team in Singapore. Producers are a critical role in our differentiated level of service that we provide NFT artists, and critical to our business‚Äôs success and growth.

Responsibilities


Recruit, onboard and coordinate top level talent that will strengthen our artist roster
Liaise, manage and produce artist drops, globally
Consult and provide recommendations on the best possible setup and drop mechanics for a successful drop
Advise artists on ways to grow and expand their brand 
Coordinate co-marketing initiatives between internal and external teams
Understand, define and convey technical requirements to our smart contract and product teams
Review and assess talent that comes across our application process


Qualifications


Familiarity with the Art or NFT Art landscape 
Ability to navigate strategic uses of NFT technology
A history of gathering and using data to drive decisions
Experience in client relationship management or art preferred
Strong passion for creating a disruptive and revolutionary platform for the art space and creator ecosystem as a whole
Strong business acumen with a demonstrated track record of successful partnerships


It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:


Health, Vision and Dental insurance covered at 100% for employees and dependents
At least 12 weeks paid Parental Leave
Up to 14 paid vacation days (in addition to public/bank holidays)
Business Travel Medical Insurance


At Gemini, we strive to build diverse teams that reflect the people we want to empower through our products, and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Equal Opportunity is the Law, and Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. If you have a specific need that requires accommodation, please let a member of the People Team know.

Title: Market Operations Specialist, Singapore
Description Snippet:
About the job
About the Company:

Worldcoin ( www.worldcoin.org ) is an open-source protocol, supported by a global community of developers, individuals, economists and technologists committed to expanding participation in, and access to, the global economy. Its community is united around core beliefs in the inherent worth and equality of every individual, the right to personal privacy, and open and public collaboration. These beliefs are reflected in what the community is building: a public utility to connect everyone to the global economy.

The Worldcoin Foundation ( www.worldcoin.foundation ) is the protocol‚Äôs steward and will support and grow the Worldcoin community until it becomes self-sufficient. Tools for Humanity ( www.toolsforhumanity.com ) is a global hardware and software development company. It helped launch Worldcoin and continues to provide support to the Foundation, in addition to operating the World App.

This opportunity would be with Tools for Humanity.

Location: Singapore

About the Team:

The Market Operations team oversees the launch strategy and deployment of Worldcoin across all markets. This team deploys and manages all orbs worldwide and serves as the primary point of contact for local Operators. This team is responsible for effectively onboarding active users to Worldcoin. Overall, the Market Operations team is on the frontlines of Tools for Humanity‚Äôs ambitious mission of global, inclusive, and rapid distribution of the Worldcoin token.

The Market Operations team consists of three subteams 1) Expansion 2) Growth Operations and 3) Central Operations. The Expansion team is responsible for the market assessment, setup, and initial go-to-market. The Growth Operations team is responsible for ongoing management, partnerships, business development, and marketing within the region. The Central Operations team enables operational excellence by ensuring alignment across all markets and providing Support and global Operator communications. All subteams work cross-functionally with many other areas of the business to ensure the successful adoption and distribution of the Worldcoin token.

About the Opportunity:

As our Market Operations Specialist, Singapore, you‚Äôll play a crucial role of managing day to day operations by proactively spotting and addressing on-the-ground issues across the markets. The day-to-day role includes collaboration with Market Operations and Logistics teams, as well as Worldcoin partners and Operators in Asia. In the role, you will close the feedback loop by spotting and sharing best practices to enable further growth. The role requires excellent coordination and organisational skills, and great attentiveness to detail.

Key Responsibilities


Sourcing for Operators
 Ensuring compliance of the newly onboarded Operators 
Operators management
 Reviewing and approving locations and events where Worldcoin might participate 
 Overseeing process of sourcing spaces for brand activations 
 Distributing training materials and monitoring the results and running face-to-face training sessions 
 Finding knowledge gaps and addressing them by understanding their nature, and devising and executing new strategies 
 Working with Operators and external partners to improve operational efficiency 
 Leading through internal process to manage locations with Operators 
 Communicating with Operators in a professional and timely manner 
 Preparing and sharing relevant documentation with the Operators 



About You:


You have 2+ years of relevant experience. You have succeeded in high-performance operations and business development in Singapore before.
You‚Äôre scrappy. You enjoy working as part of a fast-moving, dynamic team and are willing to contribute wherever needed to make an impact.
You have strong cross-cultural competency. You are able to communicate and do business across different cultures and countries and have experience working in cross-cultural environments.
You have strong interpersonal skills. You are able to manage and nurture high-performing relationships with local Worldcoin Operators in Singapore. You know that no two people are the same and are able to mediate and resolve conflicts.
You‚Äôre innovative. You love coming up with solutions to unconventional problems and taking action. 
You‚Äôre analytical. You make data-driven decisions and are eager to contribute to larger strategy conversations. Expertise in SQL is a must.
You‚Äôre based in Singapore, and are ready to travel. You have extensive experience living and working in Singapore, but are also able to spend 50-75% of your time on the road to drive growth in your region.

Title: CB- Agency Securities Lending Trader - VP
Description Snippet:
About the job
Position Overview

Details of the Division and Team:

Corporate Bank is a world-class provider of Cash Management, Trade Finance, Custody and Trust & Agency Services for Corporate Clients and Financial Institutions. The spectrum of innovative and market-leading Transaction Banking products is promoted by a skilled sales force and serviced by a dedicated team of client service professionals.

Deutsche Bank‚Äôs ASL Programme offers institutional clients a fully comprehensive service for generating incremental revenue on their fixed income and equity portfolios through the securities financing and repo markets.

The Agency Securities Lending and Liquidity Product Management Team is seeking a Trader for Securities Lending and Repos role based in Singapore.

The role in Agency Securities Lending will primarily be working as part of the ASL trading desk. The candidate will trade the securities lending market from a global perspective utilizing Asian trading hours to maximize opportunities. A key focal point will be the Asian markets with primary responsibilities at country and product level. This will involve dealing with our counterparties on a daily basis. The candidate will work with our operations group and our counterparties over the full lifecycle of trades, monitor positions, corporate actions and utilize our clients positions to maximize revenues. In addition to the trading role the candidate will also work on various short-term projects for the trading desk and the wider associated group. This involves working on client presentations, business analysis or counterparty communications.

What we will offer you:

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace.

Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits

Your key responsibilities:


Maximize revenue returns for client portfolios in the ASL program. Develop and grow existing and new relationships with clients and borrowers, expanding current on-loan balances.

Work with the ASL marketing team to price portfolios and assist with pitch material.
Provide senior management with updates on Asian developments including business, regulatory, and markets



Your skills and experience:

Prior experience with trading and marketdata platforms like EquiLend, BondLend, DataLend, IHS Markit, LendingPit, Pirum, Bloomberg

Title: Authorized Dealing Representative
Description Snippet:
About the job
DriveWealth, the pioneer of fractional equities trading and embedded investing, is a visionary technology company that empowers more than 100 partners around the world to engage their customers by placing the markets in the palm of their hand. We believe the future is fractional, transactional and mobile. Every mobile device should be a gateway to accessing investing and savings products, services, advice, and assistance for global citizens of all ages, wealth stages, and levels of financial expertise. DriveWealth‚Äôs commitment to continuous evolution and innovation makes it the partner of choice for powering the future of investing.

Completing a Series D raise in 2021, DriveWealth‚Äôs mission is to democratize investing globally by working with partners to invent new ways to use its API-based technology to provide emerging investors with cutting-edge embedded experiences, offer first-time access to U.S. markets, and the ability to begin investing with as little as $1. DriveWealth is committed to empowering consumers around the world to become owners by delivering the most modern brokerage infrastructure, unparalleled industry expertise, and a culture of continued evolution.

About The Role

DriveWealth is expanding internationally, and spearheading our growth in Asia Pacific through Singapore, as our region HQ. The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) is a multilateral development bank whose mission is financing the Infrastructure for Tomorrow‚Äîinfrastructure with sustainability at its core. We began operations in Beijing in January 2016 and have since grown to 109 approved Members worldwide. We are capitalized at USD100 billion and Triple-A-rated by the major international credit rating agencies. Collaborating with partners, AIIB meets clients‚Äô needs by unlocking new capital and investing in infrastructure that is green, technology-enabled and promotes regional connectivity.




The Compliance & Operational Risk unit, under the Risk Management Department, is responsible for governance, oversight and credibly challenging compliance and operational risk exposures and risk management practices through monitoring, analysing, and developing standards for remediating risk that arise while maintaining a balance between risk mitigation and operational efficiency.




The Compliance & Operational Risk Associate will support the Head of Compliance & Operational Risk with identifying existing and future risks across AIIB and optimizing the Compliance & Operational Risk Management Framework. They are expected to work effectively alongside key stakeholders in ensuring the continued robustness of the function.







Accountabilities & Responsibilities

Support the definition of compliance and operational risk frameworks, methodologies and documentation and oversee implementation.
Conduct risk assessments to identify, assess, measure, manage and report on compliance and operational risks.
Support the capture and management of operational risk events, including the conduct of root cause analysis and lessons learned.
Support activities related to crisis management, including the coordination of meetings and oversight of actions as directed.
Support the review and validation of compliance and operational risk aspects of outsourcing activities.
Increase the effectiveness of Management‚Äôs oversight by analysing and reporting compliance and operational risk information.
Consult with multilateral and bilateral partners and AIIB Members to improve the compliance and operational risk function of AIIB.
Keep abreast of the latest applicable regulatory developments and advise internal stakeholders on their implications and impacts.
Work with relevant AIIB departments to promote a strong risk culture through relevant training programs.







Knowledge, Skills, Experience & Qualifications

3-5 years‚Äô experience in a compliance; operational risk and/or operational resilience function with a multilateral development or financial institution.
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong interpersonal, influencing and communication skills with an ability to interact effectively with stakeholders across the organization, including virtual interactions.
A team player able to operate in a diversified and multicultural work environment.
Project management skills.
Creativity and appetite for continuous improvement.
Fluent in written and spoken English.
Bachelor‚Äôs university degree (Master‚Äôs degree preferred) in law, finance, business, or related fields.
Excellent command of Microsoft Office and other relevant software including (Tableau, Power BI etc.) including VBA and other programming skills.







AIIB is committed to diversity, transparency and inclusion. We believe our strength comes from having a team with the right diverse skills, experiences and abilities selected through a merit-based competitive process. We actively encourage applications from people from both within and outside AIIB members, regardless of nationality, religion, gender, race, disability or sexual orientation.




Previous experience and qualifications will determine the grade and job title at which successful applicants will enter AIIB.




Join us and help create a prosperous and sustainable Asia while growing your career in a diverse and innovative environment.
